Reviews.Title: “Very nice quiet resort if you are not beach people.”
Reviews.Author: Michele T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean quiet and rooms comfortable although dated. We are not pool people and wanted a beach that we could swim at. The beach had black sand that burns your feet, the water was rocky and the was a reef knee deep so you could not swim. Then we went to beach at golf club which we were told was nicer. The restaraunt smelled like garbage. English was not understood by staff. Beach chairs were set up on 4 or 5 concrete slabs covered with green astroturf that was ripped and stained, lots of disgusting trash on the beach. We headed back to our room and checked out, drove 2 hours back to Fajardo to hotel we had stayed in first few days of vaca with nice beach and blue waters. Concierge was out sick. Executive lounge was only open til 9 AM, limited offerings if you are used to Hiltons in the states, disappointing. Staff in the hotel seemed very nice, just want to warn people this is not a resort for the beach, pool area is fabulous tho. Staff recommended an excellent restaurant nearby, Casa de Chef, great food, local variety reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: swyantk
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the resort. The service was great and the room was very nice. The pool area had lots of palm tree shade and plenty of chairs. The beach wasn't as nice as we hoped for but that's geography, not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: greenidpr
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Hilton Ponce and I must say it was one of the best experiences we've had! This was our first time staying in Ponce and we were a bit apprehensive but no longer. When we first arrived at almost 3 a.m. our first experience was that we got lost driving from the airport to hotel. The GPS for some reason took us to the Plaza Caribe Mall and not to the hotel. I called and spoke with Victor at the front desk who guided me over the phone on how to get to hotel. That was awesome! Victor assigned us our room # 548 and we proceeded to bed since we were extremely tired. When we awoke a few hours later, we found that the room was NOT to our expectations. The floor was dirty and the chair was dingy and torn, not to mention that it was next to the ice machine and elevator. I went to the front desk and spoke with Hugo and explained that I wanted to have my room changed. He nonchalantly told me that they only had king beds available. We needed doubles and I told him so but he apologized and told me that king was the only option. I asked him for the Manager's name and their business card. After breakfast I went back to the front desk intending to speak with the Manager but spoke with Jose instead. This is when it all became awesome! Jose asked me for a couple of hours to see what became available after check out. He changed our room and we were provided with free breakfast, free tee-shirts and a pizza for our inconvenience. Jose made a huge difference in my expectations of how hospitable front desk staff should be. He should be commended!! Our stay was wonderful and I would highly recommend the Executive Tour, 5th floor, it has a spectacular view. I hope that the hotel will clean up room 548 and change out the chair for the next guest.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE RESORT AND THEY ACTUALLY GIVE FOR THE BIG RESORT FEE!”
Reviews.Author: KGIRL02
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. All the resorts charge a 18% Resort Fee on top of regular taxes. However, the resort fee usually doesn't give hardly any extras. The Hilton is different, we received a free large breakfast buffet, 2 free t-shirts, free drink coupons, $20 towards the casino, 3 free ice cream tickets, discount to the spa, and a free large pizza. Most resorts let you pay a lot for all these sacks and extras while you are at the pool. They also kept giving me free diet cokes and seltzer at the bar. There are also free bicycles to ride around the resort, play tennis, ping pong, and games, all no charge. The staff was really nice and helpful. Also, we had to leave at 3:00 AM for the airport so the staff made food boxes for all of us with sandwiches, fruit, water, and treats. Very Nice thing to do. Parking very reasonable, $8 day. Nice Pool with lots of seating and shaded areas. Quiet, but nice mix of people, with many from Puerto Rico who gave great recommendations about the Island. The only critique I would make is that the rooms are large and comfortable, the decor is a bit dated. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and had a terrific time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Carribean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 10 days there in March. We were looking for a quiet getaway and we got it. If you want a fast paced casino and beach experience, stay in San Juan and pay a fortune. If you want tranquility, golf, beautiful pools and ocean and a staff that is truly glad you are there, go to the Hilton Ponce Golf & Casino Resort. I suspect most complaints are because the guests were expecting plush urban American facilities. We got a great price for unlimited golf and breakfast. The rooms were great - tile floors, very comfortable beds and quiet, except for the ocean and birds. We loved it. In fact, we wish we were still there. We played about 36 holes of golf every day and had the wonderful golf course almost to ourselves. We went in to Ponce often for dinner and exploring. It was a lot of fun. The golf staff was fantastic. For that matter, all the resort staff were superb. Sancho's Sushi Bar was the only disappointment - food was not good and prices were too high. Coming from San Francisco and Washington DC we have great sushi restaurants. Sancho's could use a rehab. The La Cava restaurant was excellent - food was delicious and properly prices. The waiting staff were fantastic. The La Terraza restaurant was our morning oasis - an outdoor breakfast by a lagoon filled with fish and turtles, plus a great view of the ocean and the pool. What a great way to wake up every morning. The beach is not an idyllic beach, but it is a typical Caribbean beach. I recommend snorkeling on the reefs with Caribbean Images Tours (http://www.caribbeanimagespr.com/caribbeanimagespr.com/Welcome.html) . David Mansfield and his first mate Jorge are great guides. You'll have a fun and safe ecotour of the nearby reef. The 27 hole golf course is fairly new and a stern test when the winds come up in the afternoon. There's plenty of water so bring lots f balls for your first few rounds. Once you get your club selection and routing figured out you will be OK. A few fairways are a little rough due to either too much or too little water, but don't hold that against them. The bunkers were pretty much unplayable, but who cares. Take a drop and have fun. There are lots of birds and iguanas to entertain you along the way. The exercise facility is too small for the size of the facility and could use an expansion and equipment upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for south Puerto Rico vacation”
Reviews.Author: SmulchY
Reviews.Content: Our family of three just spent a great 5 nights an this resort. We had just spent a pretty disappointing first night in San Juan, and the beautiful drive south and the final arrival at the grounds of this very nice hotel were all we needed to revive our general worry that we weren't going to like PR. The grounds are beautiful here, the staff is all very friendly and helpful. Our 9 year old loved the pool and the other activities available at no charge (you pay a daily resort fee in addition to your hotel room though). The concierge was very helpful and knowledgable about local dining and activities and helped us schedule some of these. However, after the first few days it seems she was off and there was nobody to replace her - too bad. The beaches here are not really great, but the southwest corner of the island is said to have some of the most beautiful and they are within two hours drive. Unfortunately, we just didn't have time to get there. But there is plenty to do within an hour of this location. Historic Ponce seems to offer some things, but aside from some great restaurants we didn't venture there and don't honestly feel we missed much. Some cautions: - There are a number of additional fees you will pay attached to your room: Resort fee, parking fee, state and city taxes. For us, it added about $40 per night to our cost. - The attached golf resort offers some additional activities that include kayak, sunfish, and hobiecat rentals. I tried to rent a sunfish but the woman in charge (the only one that didn't speak English - or pretended not to- in the whole resort) told me it was too windy. I am not sure how they measure this, but I've sailed before and it was not. She only offered the kayaks which honestly if it was so windy would be completely unappealing anyway. None of the sailing boats were rigged and in the days we were there I never saw one taken out. I suspect that either the resort or this woman are completely uninterested or unable to rig them and so just use the wind as an excuse. - I noted one comment from a reviewing that it is a slightly windy location. When were there we had a beautiful breeze that comes in off the water all day - it starts very light in the morning, and picks up some speed by mid-afternoon, but I would say it was no more than 10 knots. The advantage of this was to keep the rain in the beautiful mountains to the north, which are visible from the hotel. - Some of the rooms closest to the common area can be noisy, even with the single-pane glass sliding doors closed. On weekends this can be especially unpleasant for a family that isn't in to the night life and needs there sleep. So try to get the higher numbered rooms. - Also, on the subject of room noise: the floors are all tile on concrete. Every room has a patio/deck with furniture that when moved even slightly can be heard loudly in the nearby rooms. In all, we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend it for travelers of all types.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet in southwest PR”
Reviews.Author: Annaplois
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ Hilton in Ponce 4 nights in March. Highlights:Not busy, 2 pool location choices at Club Caribe and the Hilton. No real beach at either due to reef issues; however, Club Caribe is a little better. Shuttle runs between the two locations on the resort. Pools great. Slightly windy in this location. Note if you want to kayak one needs to do this early in the morning...like 7 am...due the waves and currents, just organize it with the desk the day before. Notes on location: drive into Ponce, and hit the center of town. Some good little eateries, the striped firehouse and King's Ice Cream across from the firehouse. We took a road trip to La Parguera to see the luminescent bay area...it is a faded glory due to pollution, but it was only $6...you get what you pay for but it was still interesting. Warning on driving from Ponce...have a VERY good map. We were told a 20 minute drive...1 hour and 20 mins later we got there on back roads with horses, cows, iguana and a very narrow road in some places. Slow and white knuckle driving to get back....warning...have a good map and frankly a map won't help in town...just follow the flow of people. For fun...hiking, rappelling & zip line with Del Sur Adventures...with Alfonso and George...well done, a bit unnerving the first time over a waterfall cliff. They take you to an old coffee plantation which is a great hiking area. The hang out at the watering hole for late afternoon lunch was fun too.

Reviews.Title: “just arrived yesterday!”
Reviews.Author: xoxo1212
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this review as I sit on my balcony in the Executive tower... And I wanted to go ahead and get some of my thoughts down before I forgot them. 1. The bad (or what might be considered the "bad": the beach... It's a dark sand beach, which means the water isn't clear like in St Thomas or at other islands... However, the sand is super soft...then there is a layer of rocks... Then the water. I've read people complain about the rocks, but here's a tip...if you look hard enough... You can find seaglass in those rocks, which I think is pretty awesome... And i've already collected a large handful! 2. The pool is beautiful and well kept... It does have a lot of palms, but there are areas to lay in the sun! We haven't yet been to the pool at the golfncourse, but we may try that tomorrow! 3. We've eaten at El Bohio... The poolside bar. Delish! We just had an appetizer sampler and some drinks, but it was great and reasonable (in my opinion)... Their local beer is great! Light and refreshing! 4. We have a rental car... So we made a trip to the supermarket and picked up beer, water, sandwich stuff and cokes! Prices are pretty comparable to the continental US! 5. Most staff that we've come in contact with have been pleasant... And helpful, which is nice! I'll update later as the week progresses!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! But a few tips.......”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently completed a week of vacation at the Hilton Ponce. Overall we had a very good experience and the resort was truly lovely. I would offer a few tips to future visitors: 1. Don't bother upgrading the the Executive Tower. We did, and after one night we asked to be moved. We were moved to a room in the West Tower which was actually a much nicer room. The Executive Tower room had a great view, but the shower was awful, we were too far away from the actual lobby and restaurants, and the daily "reception" in the Tower lounge is a joke. Not worth the extra money. 2. Don't expect to walk on the beach at night as there is a fence around the property that is locked at 6pm for security purposes. Not a huge deal but would have been nice to know before we went, or at least alerted to this when we checked in. On the plus side, the food was excellent in the resort restaurants, and the pool and grounds are gorgeous. The resort needs a bit more shopping choices, as there is only one small store and it is hidden in a corner and very very limited in what it carries.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TJS44
Reviews.Content: We found the Ponce Hilton to be a seceluded gem. Outstanding views, excellent service at check-in, during our stay and at check-out, great place to run, walk on the beach, collect sea glass, swim in the two pools, play tennis, read with the sound of the waves, kayak, tryed our luck at the casino or just people watch by the pool. Food is good and exceptional at the Cava Restruant. Don Q happy hour was a great way to relax and chat. Enjoyed the convienence of the executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nuyoricanone
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped onto the property everyone was very helpful. Our room was a bit far from the lobby but the view from our balcony surely made up for it. Our first night we enjoyed traditional "bar food" by the pool. The service was ok. Breakfasts were great and very hearty and the service was excellent. It was a group of four adults so I cannot speak for any children experiences but I did see quite a few enjoying themselves at the pool and arcade. Overall a great choice and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “The Kriollisimo Restaurant at the Hilton/Costa Caribe is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: gaterp
Reviews.Content: If you want the best Puerto Rican food go to this nice little spot in the Costa Caribe Golf Club on the Hilton property outside of Ponce! My husband and I fell in love with their delicious, healthy, authentic food and we could not wait to go back there for another delicious meal. The staff is friendly and helpful and will share recipes with you and will gladly explain what they are offering if it is not familiar with you. I learned to love the fresh, aromatic Puerto Rican flavors and I was inspired to cook like this at home. Yummy! Nelson, our waiter on one occasion and Sarail, the Assistant Food and Beverage Manager who helped us on another occasion were delightful and made us feel comfortable and served us well. The view of their beautiful pool and ocean topped off our pleasant experience and I can't wait to return! It was by far the best food that we ate during our week long stay at the Hilton Ponce. We ate in town too but The Kriollisimo couldn't be beat! Don't miss it! There is a free shuttle that goes back and forth between the Hilton to the Costa Caribe so pack your swimsuit or golf clubs and enjoy this quiet, lovely spot after you have lunch there. They are only open for lunch though but it is served everyday. They also offer a wonderful salad bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnsternaz
Reviews.Content: We are staying in Ponce for a dive my husband is taking. It is a beautiful property, not beachfront though if that is what you want. There is a fence by the beach and you can go through a gate near the pool. It's more of a place to lay out by the pool and enjoy the view. One thing that is great is the pool bar is open til midnight and still have food too during the week. On Tuesday night, we had drinks and hung out, it was quite busy. We are also staying up at the Wyndham Rio Mar in Rio Grande and we were really disappointed on Sunday they closed the pool/beach bar at 6pm. People were still there. They keep the hotel freezing so we weren't wanting to drink at the lobby bar!

Reviews.Title: “A strange hotel. Not worth it if you don't have kids”
Reviews.Author: mlferm
Reviews.Content: We just got here and found it very strange. First, hotels are booked in San Juan but there is no one here. Ok, so Ponce is not San Juan, but there is almost no one here. Very eerie. The beach is almost non-existant. It looks like they have lots for kids to do, but if you are two adults, I think you are goign to be bored. The room is fine. Nothing special, but clean and large enough. The hotel is sprawling, which is not bad, but without people, it is weird.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tsk_02
Reviews.Content: Came to PR for work in early Feb and stayed here for 5 days. I brought my wife and 2 year old son. We had a great time at the hotel/resort. Great looking place. Our room was modern, comfortable, and included a great ocean front view with balcony. One night, the hotel offered free happy hour cocktails and hors d'oeuvres. The breakfast buffet was included for us (though typically extra) and was excellent... my wife enjoyed that very much... had great variety and made-to-order omelettes, even eggs benedict! (the cook was very friendly). The hotel felt safe with a guarded gate entrance. Location was great... a few minutes from the boardwalk area and 10 mins from the Ponce city center. The hotel had a private beach, but the waves seemed really rough (not good for young children), thus we opted for other beaches about 30-40mins away, which are excellent for families and children. The hotel staff were readily available, friendly, and helpful on recommendations to outside restaurants and beaches. My son kept busy at the pool while I was at work, and there were plenty of activities to keep anyone busy (basketball, mini golf, table tennis, tennis, board games, bicycles, kids bowling, etc...). My wife kept busy... by our 2 yr-old (lol). The casino seemed lively, though we didn't go inside (had a 2-yr old with us!). There was even a very decent arcade area that kids/teenagers would enjoy. Would definitely come back here, if given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...”
Reviews.Author: zaezae
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before and was looking forward to a return visit. I arrived late around 10:30pm and could not wait to go to sleep. I was shocked when I arrived to my room to find there was NO BED. I actually called the front desk looking for it. I had an end room so there were two baclonys (including a hammock) but since I didn't want to sleep outside I was concerned. Turned out that I had what they call a 'parlor' room - the bed is a pull out couch. WHAT?!?! After a long day of travel this was the last thing I wanted to hear. Although there were very nice to offer to send someone to make up the bed for me, what I really wanted was a new room with an actual bed. The front desk was NOT willing to move me. They said the hotel was full and that I was out of luck. I was stunned since I had booked this ahead of time and my reservation was confirmed. After demanding a new room they were able to accommodate me and lo and behold gave me the room right next door. Weird that I had to get angry before this could happen. The decor in the room was nice - very updated from my last stay. The lock on the adjoining door was broken, which bothered me as I was staying by myself. After day 2 they were able to fix the lock. There are several eating choices and one nice sit down restaurant here. The sit down place is uber expensive 'La Cava' but the food is great. I loved the lobster puff appetizer. The breakfast buffet is very nice and I looked forward to eating there each morning. Also, I loved the cherry juice served one morning - scared to know what makes it taste so good. :-) The 'store' on site was very lacking. Strange location and seems to be almost forgotten about. I was looking to buy a book and the didn't offer anything like that - in English or Spanish. I always use the Valet and they are very good. Overall, I would stay again - but I would call ahead next time to ensure I am getting an actual bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: bunbop
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about the resort but there is nothing to gush about either. We prefer the smaller hotels and this one was quite large and very busy. We had a room in the Executive Tower which was very clean and comfortable. These rooms have not been updated yet as the other ones have been so they are a little outdated but adequate. Our ocean view more than made up for it. Put me on a balcony with an ocean view and I'm loving it! We did not go to the beach on the main property, but we went to the golf course beach because we read on here that it was nicer. But we had a car so we mainly found our own beaches on the south/west side of P.R. The pools were nice but much quieter at the golf course if you don't have kids. We thoroughly enjoyed the golf course and enjoyed 2 days of golf. The staff at the restaurant for breakfast (Executive Lounge is closed on weekends) was amazing! They made us feel welcome, like family, very attentive. Great job! Housekeeping staff was wonderful too! I am giving a rating for Service as very good only because the front desk staff could use a little work.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful laid back resort”
Reviews.Author: blindref1
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Ponce as part of a tour of Puerto Rico which included San Juan and Fajardo. I really enjoyed our stay at this Hilton. The property is very clean. The rooms all look out to the Ocean. We were able to leave our doors open at night and listen to the surf as we drifted off to sleep and again as we awoke. In the morning, we enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The service in the restaurant is prompt. The pool is very shaded by palm trees. We spent our time on the beach. It is small but not crowded. There is also pool and beach access at the golf club. We had dinner at La Cava and it was a great experience. Our waiter was outstanding. I enjoyed the salmon very much. This is a great place if you want to relax and chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: evriv
Reviews.Content: We checked in and went to our room in the Executive Tower to find a Murphy Bed pull out bed in a 70's decor room. I checked my reservation that showed I requested a King bed. This Murphy bed was between a double and queen size bed! Returned to the front desk to inquire and they were very accommodating to change our room; however it took 4 1/2 hours to get in the room. We were flexible since we knew we arrived early and check in was at 3pm. So we relaxed by the pool and had a snack. By 3pm the room still was not ready we left our phone number with the front desk to call us... still nothing. After 4pm we walked back to find out if the room was ready. They finally gave us our keys. I complained that this is the exact reason why we do not travel to PR (our own country) due to the lack of customer service and prefer to travel to all inclusives in Mexico and DR. Where upon they offered us coupons for a free drink and a pizza. Despite the frustration this room was very nicely appointed and modern. We enjoyed our stay after all and it was nice to go back to the quiet resort after all the noise in the town of Ponce during the carnival festivities! If management reads this: Clemente from valet was fabulous. He gave us great tips for restaurants both in and out of the resort. He was super friendly and a great guy. We love to eat with the locals and know the difference we asked him for a panaderia and he recommended a panaderia that had great coffee and pan de agua sandwiches YUM! All in all we enjoyed our stay at Ponce HIlton. The beach and pool area at Caribe was quiet and nice. The resort amenities were nice if you have children with you. Our two nights there were relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation at the Hilton Ponce”
Reviews.Author: Robear3
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 2/6/12 - 2/13/12. Our stay was excellent. The rooms are modern and clean with all the amenities you could possibly need. The property itself is beautifully maintained, tastefully landscapped and the pools and hot tub are very inviting. The gym is modern and well maintained. They have a nice long beach front that is clean with plenty of chaise lounges and canopys. They have a playground, basketball and tennis courts. The Hilton has an Executive Lounge that is open from 6-9am and 6-9pm. They provide complimentary food and beverage in the evening that includes Don Q Rum! The staff couldn't be more accomodating and there is a Casino and golf course for those who enjoy the game. Best of all is the price. You can not find a deal like this anywhere else on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - boring location”
Reviews.Author: TheNeeces
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Ponce Hilton - The resort and grounds are pretty. The beach, not so much. This hotel is 1.5 hours from San Juan - which is approx. $300 roundtrip fare via taxi/car service. We were going with another couple and didn't really do our research on this location. I think we should have stayed in San Juan as far as bars/restaurants/things to do, etc. We wanted to zip line, but that was an hour cab back toward San Juan, so we decided to pass. There is really nothing to do in the area that is close. We went into town and saw the Old Firehouse and The Boardwalk - waste of time. Service at the resort was good at the front desk and with the concierge. Clemente drove us to the other pool one day, very nice and spoke good English. The rest of the staff at the pool bars, etc had trouble with English which made asking questions about menu items difficult- there is another pool near the golf course which we found to be better than the main pool. You can't see the ocean from the main pool and there are a lot of trees which block the sun. We were in the Executive Tower, which had a nice ocean view and great balcony. Executive Lounge is lacking as others have mentioned...cerial and sandwich items - that's about it. Also, was not stocked well. It is also closed on Sat/Sun, but ask for breakfast vouchers and you can get the full breakfast on the weekend...we would have not known if I hadn't called. You would think they would have given us the vouchers at check-in, but no, had to ask for them. there is a Managers Reception on Thursday nights - found out about that by accident too - but there were nice appitizers and rum drinks. The rooms were clean, but had trouble getting towels, etc. restocked. I guess the main problem I had with the place was, for the price, we expected better service. They knew we were there over the weekend, we should have had breakfast vouchers in our packet at check-in, along with information about the reception on Thursday night, etc. Also, there is no waiter service in the pool area - that would have been nice. It seems they cater more to weddings and conventions than regular hotel guests. I don't mind paying high prices when on vacation, but I expect to be treated like they're happy we're here, which didn't seem to be the case at this hotel. We will not return - too remote and service lacking.

Reviews.Title: “lovely resort, good beach, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Mira G
Reviews.Content: First trip to Puerto Rico and loving every minute of it. We spent two nights in old city in San Juan, then came to Ponce to get away from the city, see different part of island. Hilton resort is everything I expected from my favorite chain -- nice pool, lots of stuff for kids, great service, tho rooms and lobby are a bit dated. Beach is long and water is gorgeous, calm and warm, but a bit rocky and not the white sand you'd expect in the Caribbean. Can, however, walk to a nice little boardwalk with snack shops and heard there's also a ferry to nearby Coffin Island. Be sure to take advantage of fridge in room and head to town to buy snacks -- food is expensive and of mixed quality. Lunch is only available from poolside bar with limited and mediocre menu (pizza was dreadful, quesedillas passable) Dinner at La Terrazza steakhouse was surprisingly good -- but entrees are $24-28. breakfast is $19 for buffet (we haven't tried it yet) View from rooms in executive tower is amazing -- palm trees, beach, gorgeous blue sea -- and possibly worth the upgrade bc of free breakfast and evening snacks and drinks served in exec lounge Mon-Fri.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Things were awesome, but...”
Reviews.Author: V M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at the Ponce Hilton on the weekend before Valentine's Day 2012. The hotel is very nice and at a great location. I pre-arranged with the hotel's concierge (by phone) to have flowers and ballons put in our hotel room for my wife. The Concierge was AWESOME. She used a reputable local flower shop that put together an amazing arrangement for not that much money. Everything at the hotel was awesome until Sunday morning. My wife and I had planned to sleep in a little late and relax in the room. However, promptly at 8:00 a.m., we were startled awake by the sound of BLARING music. The music was so loud, we could barely hear each other speak. My wife called the front desk to make them aware of the situation, but the music continued. After about one hour of this, my wife stepped outside the room to see what was going on. The only thing she could see were other hotel guests standing outside trying to figure out what was going on. We couldn't see who was playing the music or why, but it was clearly coming from over-sized, industrial strength set of speakers that are used at an outside concert. We finally decided to get up and dressed by 10:30 a.m. and went to breakfast. The music continued to blare. When we went outside, we noticed that some sort of politically rally was in progress and was the source of the music. The music continued until we decided to leave (around 12 noon). I'm not sure why they decided to have the rally blare music beginning at 8a.m. on a Sunday, nor do I no why the hotel did not provide us guests with a fore warning, but it did put a cloud over an otherwise wonderful weekend at a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation Resort”
Reviews.Author: jkfhope
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Puerto Rico and my husband I wanted to stay somewhere other than the San Juan area. We like to stay at resorts on the beach with nice pools and this hotel definitely fit the bill. We stayed in the executive tower and our room was very nice and had a wonderful view. The pool is large and the area around it has a nice mix of shade and sun. The beach was nice (it is public), but not as nice as what we are used to on Lake Michigan, so we mainly stayed by the pool. The lobby was alittle dated, but we don't go on vacation to spend time in the lobby! The outdoor areas and rooms were very nice, so that is all that really mattered to us. Although we did not take advantage of it, it did seem like they had lots of activity options for families. There is a mini golf course, playground, tennis and basketball courts as well as other games. I could definitely see us returning once my husband and I start a family because I think kids would have lots to do there. The food in La Cava was excellent. It is a bit pricy, but worth it for a nice dinner. We were there over the super bowl and our service in La Terraza during the game was horrible, but they were busy. The food there and from the pool bar is mediocre. Since you pretty much have to have a rental car due to the location I would highly suggest eating most meals outside the resort to save money and have increased quality. (I will be reviewing area restaurants we ate at as well) La Cava is really the only one worth the money you pay. If you can stay over a Thursday I would highly recommend it, because they do have a managerâ€™s reception with free drinks and appetizers, which were all great. The staff really made an effort to talk with the guests, see how their stay was going and make recommendations for things to do. For a relaxing vacation where you want to soak up some sun this hotel is a great option, and from we could tell the only true resort option in Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: The Hilton resort in Ponce is probably the best in the area. The staff were very friendly and the hotel was well maintained. Our room had a view of the ocean and I believe all the rooms did. The executive lounge snacks and breakfast were not very good but the staff was very nice. I think the executive lounges of all the Hilton's might be reducing their services/food based on my experience. Don't bother paying extra for the executive floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, and Very Relaxing!!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca K
Reviews.Content: This was my first vacation with my husband since we got married in 2009. We had the time of our life. The staff could not have been more accommodating. We looked forward to breakfast every morning because we got to talk to Alejandro, a supervisor, and he was so helpful in helping us plan our days. He knew which places to avoid and which places not to miss. And he was so upbeat and friendly, you couldn't help but smile after talking to him. All of the staff were friendly, some more than others, but Orlando (bartender) was the highlight!! He made us feel like we were the only ones at his bar and was wonderful company while we relaxed at the bar. Our hotel room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. Our bed was amazing!! I mean I wanted to bring it home with me. Can't say enough about how comfy we slept!! We had a fantastic view! The food and drink was fairly expensive, but you would expect that anywhere you go. Ponce is a great location even though it is not as metropolitan as San Juan but still had it's own highlights. Ponce is located very conveniently on the island so you could see a new part of the island everyday without driving too far from the hotel and still make it home to have some beverages and dinner. All in all our experience was top notch. We will definitely return again (hopefully sooner than later) and would recommend this for singles, couples, or families!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a resort feeling.”
Reviews.Author: Junyer561
Reviews.Content: I loved my trip but I really wished I stayed in San Juan. The reviews for the resort got me sold but there was nothing to do in Ponce. The hotel sold me a ocean front patio and got there and was staring at sand and a big ole nothing. I had to complain 2 times to get it changed. The breakfast was 19.99 per person wow was not worth it but got to town and spent about the same. Wow as far as the looks and people at the hotel I give them a high score. Best hotel I ever stayed at. Orlando the bartender was coolest person I met in Ponce. The guard who gave us directions told us how to get to the nice beaches all over 1 hour away. We went to San Juan and the food was cheaper and everything was close. I would have rather stayed at a less nicer hotel and had more choices on food and nighttime activities.

Reviews.Title: “Very short very pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: mayumi007
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night during the La Vuelta PR bike ride,and since I arrived after 6;30 pm and left at 6am did not see enough of the hotel beach pools and grounds. Considering there were over 50 riders arriving together check in was quick and efficient. Have a problem with being charged additional reort tax especially when I did not have chance to experience any of the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “It's pricey but it has everything you'll need”
Reviews.Author: rick1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the executive tower with ocean view on the 3rd floor at the southwest corner. Our room was large, tastefully decorated, quiet, fresh and very clean. The room has a large balcony and is near the shoreline. We had the door open the whole night to enjoy the surf-sound. There are several restaurants onsite and we had an excellent dinner at La Cava. The casino appeared to be bustling. There is a large pool as well as ocean beach frontage.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: The grounds and beach are very nice and this would be a great short vacation spot. The rooms aren't as nice as your 'typical' Hilton, but overall the room quality was fine. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. Enjoy a drink and meal at the bar in the pool area, a very nice setting. My only complaint are the additional costs that can be incurred while staying here. $8 a day to self-park. $20 for breakfast at the restaurant. Noting outrageous, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: pcr01
Reviews.Content: We again took our annual trip to this hotel. We had a wonderful trip. The hospitality at this hotel is always wonderful. The employees always have a smile. LaCava, their high end restaurant is the best kept secret on the island. Great food,superior service and lots of fine wine. Cannot wait for next year..

Reviews.Title: “Costa Caribe Golf & Country Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: Nasajat
Reviews.Content: We went to my best friends wedding at the restaurant and we loved staying at the villas. So nice and so quiet. We are from Ponce and had a great time. There is so much to do. The villas are very spacious and the decor is very modern and tropical. The housekeeper was very friendly and made us feel at home. We enjoyed all The Hilton's amenities. If you go with a group of friends this is a must!!! Its like being at home on your vacation. I believe they also sell the villas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun golf course”
Reviews.Author: jcmbdm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent New Years weekend at the Hilton Ponce. The hotel was very nice. it took advantage of the wonderful Ponce weather with the main area of the hotel open to the outside. The pool area was very nice with plenty of seating around the pool. The beach was great and the rooms were in good condition with the comfy Hilton beds. Our favorite part was the golf course. The hotel has 27 holes so you can mix together 9's to get different rounds each time. Each 9 was a little different. All had wind to contend with. Each 9 had one hole that played up to the ocean for some great views. They also have the only island green on one of the par 3's. The course was not busy and it was in good shape. We played golf in Dorado as well, but this course was much more interesting and in better shape than the Dorado del Mar or Plantation courses in Dorado. When we go back to Puerto Rico for another golf vacation- we will definitely return to the Ponce Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Costa Caribe Golf & Country Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: jjayjr
Reviews.Content: We spent the New Year Holiday in a 5 bedroom villa of the Golf community. It was beautiful and everyone agreed it was one of the best trips we made. The resort has it's own club house and peaceful pool area steps from the beach. The weather was perfect. The Hilton is a short walk over the bridge for the gym, hotel restaurants, casino. They have a shuttle between the villa resort and the hotel. The ride from San Juan to Ponce is a little over an hour and the scenery over the mountains is spectacular. The golf course has 27 holes and is in fantastic shape. This side of Puerto Rico is a hidden jem to be discovered by visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We just finished our fifth visit here over the Christmas holiday and, once again, it was a great time and a great value. The staff is wonderful and treat us like family. The accommodations are wonderful and the service is great. I would highly recommend this resort for families looking for a great place that is also a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fruit lovers this is not place to eat breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Ladyrcz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been given a complete makeover. The rooms are absolutely georgeous. All the rooms have breathtaking views of the ocean and the staff is courteous and accommodating. Even with all the improvements that have been made there is area that needs improvement and that is the breakfast buffet. One would expect that in a tropical island such as puerto Rico a display of native fruits would be provided to their guests. To the contrary all you see for breakfast are a few slices of melons and rarely a few bananas. Very disappointing. As a world traveler who has had the opportunity to see and eat each country's native fruits, I would have to give this hotel one out of five stars in the breakfast buffet area.

Reviews.Title: “Love!”
Reviews.Author: hrme17
Reviews.Content: If you could describe the perfect mix of value and luxury for a resort vacation, this place would be right up there. The staff were exceptional, the service was incredible and the newly renovated room a big plus. I can't recommend this place enough. We'd just come from San Juan and the difference in the Hilton experience was like night and day. While the public areas of Ponce Hilton don't have the most current decor (think late 80's concrete mall), this hotel's got where it counts: nice rooms, pretty good value for the money, decent food, great amenities and helpful staff. I was a little worried at first about the "golf and casino" part of the name (we are a family with young kids, not golfers or gamblers), but neither factored into our experience. The casino is well separated from the main areas. The pool area is lovely. There is also a playground, small beach (separated from the hotel by a hill, great because it tempers the ocean breeze when you're at the pool), tennis courts, bike/jogging path, indoor games (foosball, ping pong, arcade), and probably various other amenities we didn't even see. Free wi-fi was very reliable. The city of Ponce has a number of attractions, including a world class art museum, and is an easy drive/cab ride from the hotel. Ponce is also a great base for day trips to other parts of the island. Next time we vacation in PR we're planning to skip San Juan entirely, fly straight to Ponce, and spend the whole week here. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: bradyboy66
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12/26-9 in the Executive Tower with Ocean Views and found the hotel to be clean, comfortable and the staff very friendly and accommodating. Given the vacation week, it was not very crowded which was nice. My kids enjoyed all the activities, especially the mini golf. Nice to be able to use the facilities at golf course as well. The beach is has "black sand" but didn't bother us much.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Ponce, PR”
Reviews.Author: Mhayw6
Reviews.Content: Beach front suite. Great location. Quite and secluded from the city. Beach front small but nice. Golf reasonable for hotel guests. Stay in executive wing, parking is very close. Will not have to walk through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Update Needed”
Reviews.Author: ICUHEN
Reviews.Content: The location of the property is asolutely perfect. I arrived at night exhausted from my trip from DEN to SJU - and then my 2 hr. drive to Ponce. The room was spacious and very comfortable. I awoke at first light and was blown away by the oceanview. The hotel as a whole needs a makeover equipped with 21st Century elevators, but the view that particular morninig was something I really needed. I will without a doubt stay again on business. I don't think, though, I would bring my family to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for quiet relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Marianna2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place for a quiet, relaxing get away. Rooms are pleasant and always immaculate. Grounds are well cared for. They have done a lot of work to improve the beach area and make it an attractive alternative to sitting by the pool. The breakfast buffet is wonderful - great coffee, fresh pastries, eggs any way you want them - everything fresh and fabulous. Sometimes the mixed drinks at the pool side bar are weak and more of a fruit juice drink - a minor problem - and once in a while it is hard to find anyone from the bar checking the pool area to see if you want a snack or drink. The staff - it is the people at a hotel who can make your vacation a hit or a miss and, in this case, it is always a hit! From in-house reservations tocheck-in staff to the breakfast chefs, to the restaurant and bar staff, to room service, cleaning staff, etc - always welcoming and helpful. They put in a lot of effort to make your stay enjoyable and I think this is what puts the Ponce Hilton a step above other hotels. As for the few reviews mentioning that rooms are dated and in need of a face lift - it is my understanding that the majority of the rooms in this hotel have been recently renovated. Perhaps management could address this here with a comment.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable but not beautiful”
Reviews.Author: farm2fork
Reviews.Content: We always stay here since it is reliable but the hotel needs an upgrade. Rooms are a little humid and decor is dated. We do like the open reception, bar, restaurant area with views to the beach. Pool is fun and beach is just okay. The piÃ±a coladas are quit good so it makes for a relaxing visit to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a Face Lift”
Reviews.Author: CollTom
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive: The service is excellent, especially the pool side bar. Orlando is a great bartender: Always friendly and helpful. The front-desk people are also very helpful. The downside: The hotel badly needs a face lift. It looks so tired! That's not what I expect from a Hilton Resort and we stay at Hilton's on a regular basis. Also there are little details that make it a subpar experience, like cigarette butts lying around (although it is a no-smoking hotel!), water leaking into the room when it rains, and a small towel that lies outside the executive lounge on the same place for 3 days. Rooms should have robes and slippers! The spa is a dark unattractive room and the lounge chairs are from the 80s.

Reviews.Title: “Golf, Service, Pool and Caribbean Sea a great value vacation destination”
Reviews.Author: dantidal
Reviews.Content: This is our 11th trip to PR in 8 years, and the reason for our many returns is "HILTON PONCE GOLF & CASINO RESORT". The value you received with the golf package is fantastic, full breakfast buffet, water-view room, manicured golf course all for one fair price. From the moment we pull into the hotel, the valets greet us with a smile, Jose at the front desk and the rest of the staff make my wife and I feel like family. We can not say enough about Alejandro and his breakfast crew, a perfect way to start your day. Elli and Erik over at the golf course truly make sure their staff tend to your every need on their challenging 27 holes. After golf, we always enjoy a swim in the warm waters of the Caribbean sea and a trip to the hot tub and pool. Dinner at the La Cava is a must for at least one night and Jorge your dinning mgr will see that your every need is taken care of and I recommend the Lamb Chops and my wife loved the Filet Mignon. PONCE weather in November and February when we vacation seems always to be the same 88-90 degree, breezy and dry, perfect for playing golf and enjoying the beach. Ponce Hilton is about 90 mins. from San Juan by car through the mountains on a main road, and it is a real nice ride and you get to see the real Puerto Rico. Ponce Central has many places to visit and dine and is only a 10 min. ride by car. My wife and I are already planning our next trip to Hilton Ponce in February for golf and to continue to explore the southwestern parts of Puerto Rico. Do not let me forget the casino, nice place to visit but remember to leave when you get ahead !! Thanks again for an enjoyable vacation and we look forward to our next visit in February. Muchas gracias........ Daniel and Beatriz

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...8 years and counting”
Reviews.Author: rchiarelli6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem and so is the staff...from the front desk, to the waiters, to the housekeeping personnel, and even the parking attendants. We have been coming here for the last eight years and look forward every year to a warm welcome and relaxing stay. Any problems or issues that might arise are dealt with immediately and courteously.

Reviews.Title: “Alternative Golf Destination”
Reviews.Author: Bubby03054
Reviews.Content: Partnership with Costa Caribe golf course is a huge plus for this property. 27 holes, uncrowded, great staff! Location is a relatively easy 90 minute drive from San Juan. Acceptable off site dining options are limited in the area. Pito's Seafood is a nice seasside location about 30 minutes away by car. The one negative is breakfast at the Hilton where dozens of very aggressive birds are always on alert - making it impossible to lean back and relax over the morning paper.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Ponce is the Best of the Best!”
Reviews.Author: Saffron C
Reviews.Content: This resort is a 5 star all the way and is well rounded for all types of travelers! My husband and I along with our 4 year old twins had a blast! The amenities and catering they did for not only adults but for children is what makes it the perfect place for us! Happy Children makes happy parents! The wonderful staff which made our trip Feb 2011 worthwhile at this resort! Right on the beach yet very secluded and peaceful is also why we picked this resort! Alejandro Breban - This man is the epitome of Customer Service. He made us feel like we were family at your hotel. He always had a smile on his face and a cheerful demeanor. To let you know, he would go out of his way to make sure my family and I always had a wonderful breakfast. Even the little things he did, like bring my children a plate of fruit or juices, really showed his dedication and his professionalism. We believe he should be moved up whithin your executive ranks. Hopefully there will be spot for him somewhere within your organization with a big office someday. Jose Caquias - Jose would either be at the Executive Lounge or at the front desk. On our first day of checking in and going to the Executive Lounge he was there and he remembered us from a year ago. Again, nothing but a professional in all he did. Always courteous and well informed. Even when he was dealing with some unruly guests in the lounge, he always kept his cool and smiled the entire time. He showed attentiveness to the customers needs and went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect within the lounge. John Maldonado - I will be shocked to hear he was one of your waiters because the way he presented himself and acted you would believe he was management. Either way a constant professional and knows how to treat and speak to people on vacation. In a conversation with him, he told me he treats people like he would want to be treated when on vacation. Jessica (last name unknown) - This young lady was one of the waitresses for the outside bar and pool area. I don't think my wife and I have ever had such great service from a server. She was very quick on bringing our drink and food orders and always had a wonderful smile on her. Even when she was the only one working the pool she never wavered on her service. Great Job. There were also others but these four stood out amongst them all. Just love this place and we hope you will too! The Camacho Peep's

Reviews.Title: “Business in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: thepearl8
Reviews.Content: The property makes you feel like you are on vacation even though it was a business trip. Great view of the Caribbean. Food choices were excellent plus the downtown for places were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disapointment!”
Reviews.Author: M_alsina_M
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review while staying in the hotel... Where should i start... Im staying here for business unfortunately with visitors from the mainland.. Since I arrived at the front gate i knew i was going to have a bad experience.. 1) it smell pretty bad in the area 2) the personel is not friendly 3)Elevator out of service 4) the room is a mess, pillow covers dirty, ants in the bed, toleteries were used.. I cant even discribe! 5) the restaurant La Cava mediocre and slow service and to make matter worst there was a bug on the glass of wine one of the guest. I just can't believe the reviews below were some of the reviewers are saying they had a good stay, its hard to believe?? Im wondering if they are legit??? Its a shame that the "best rated" hotel in the area is this bad... Huge disapointment.....

Reviews.Title: “Ask me, I LIVE HERE, NO BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmJay_1956
Reviews.Content: Since 2008 I have been literally living most of my time at this wonderful hotel. I thought about updating my review, many great things have happened since I arrived in 2008 but I read some other reviews first. I was concerned about the mention of bugs at the Hotel. There are bugs everywhere in Puerto Rico, yes and the iguanas are green and beautiful until they eat all the fruits on your trees. Going back to the BUG issue, I think I can clarify that they do not have bed bug at the hotel. But if you are itching all over that can be true. In an effort to make your stay at the hotel memorable, some time ago the hotel upgraded their pillows and duvet covers to down feather inserts. I am allergic to feathers so when the change was made I asked to keep the synthetic materials. At times when I have left and returned for another long stay, months at a time I have forgotten about the change and the first night can be an agony. Earlier this year I forgot about the change and actually ended up going to the doctor, when he mentioned allergy I remembered the feathers. Now I call ahead before I arrive and request that the bedding be changed, which they do and actually write it down on your reservation, they take these matters seriously. So for those of you who thought it was bed bugs you might have an answer here, and if you are allergic to feathers and are planning on coming to the hotel let them know ahead of time. Now for the new review. The hotel has upgraded many rooms; the gym got excellent new equipment with individual TVâ€™s while you exercise or music. The restaurants keep changing menus to make choices more inviting. The lunch Kriollisimo at Costa Caribe is excellent and the prices are reasonable. Breakfast with Jimmy at the Terraza Breakfast Buffet is fantastic, if you donâ€™t see what you want, ASK! They aim to please. Eggs Benedict, Cappuccino, Salmonâ€¦ The Executive Lounge has introduced a different International experience every evening of the week. La Cava Restaurant for when you want to splurge and enjoy a great evening is still a great choice. If not just stay in your room and order room service all the restaurants deliver, and no it will not break your piggy bank. The Staff is Number one. I donâ€™t say that lightly, from the moment you enter the Hotel the people at the parking counter, bell hops, main desk, housekeeping, grounds keeping, pools, restaurants, executive lounge, turn down service in the evenings, "Gabriel Lara loves you!", too many to mention them all, are happy, friendly great people waiting to make your stay the best ever. I wish to thank Mareldys Rodriguez as a representative of all the wonderful people that work at this hotel I call my home. ***They will call for taxi service to Airport or elsewhere. Rooms have a small refrigerator, coffee machine and microwaves are available for a price. Internet service is FAST!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: WpgFoodie101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for work and was impressed by the rooms, location and views of this hotel. I had read an earlier review for this hotel which indicated that there were bed bugs, and I was mortified to stay here, however I can tell you that I did not have any issues with bugs in the room that I stayed in, nor did I hear from anyone that I was travelling with that there were bed bugs. The beach was beautiful and there were many pools as well to play in. Didn't get a chance to spend any time doing this, but imagine it would be fantastic. Breakfast is incredibly expensive, so I would suggest only eating here if you'll get your money's worth. Food overall at the hotel is average. Business centre at this hotel is dated, but serves its purpose. Would definitely return here to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Quality, would love to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: majones7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Exceptional service, extremely nice and modern rooms, multiple dining options, hotel was also quiet, large rooms, somewhat fast internet as well, amazing view!!! Cons: bathroom was a bit dated, but wasn't bad at all (see photos). The Bohio Sports Bar (which did have very reasonable prices) had a very limited menu.

Reviews.Title: “Last time”
Reviews.Author: pbrice412
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time at this hotel and will be the last first I reserved a room poolside and ocean view they put me on the second floor when I have problems with elevators and steps changed my room and needless to say told the maid everyday you have to kill the bugs in bathroom and in bedroom. Asked if she could please change sheets daily for I broke out with a rash on my face and legs. It was not only me but my husband also and after 10night I was woken by something crawling on my face and to my surprise bed bugs.Took pictures and know going to doctors since I came home. They wanted me to go the day I was leaving but I did not want to miss my flight. Filled out incident report. And will be last time going to this hotel. Besides the fact had to get all my clothes and luggage sterilized.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: DNA_J_11
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. I had been to San Juan before and wanted something less....well, everything. Less crowded, less expensive, less casino-y and more options. We stayed here and loved the pool and beach (even though it was spring break, we had the pool and beach to ourselves much of the time there!). The town and the boardwalk were fun to experience and we took several day trips. Driving is just like at home - remember, this is a US territory! There was one tiny issue and management bent over backwards to compensate for it. It was a nice sized room on the first floor, so we felt like we had a giant backyard - with a pool, beach and palm trees! Did I mention how gorgeous the grounds are?

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: 325irollin
Reviews.Content: When I say diamond in the rough, I mean this place was something nice on an island I don't really like that much. Don't get me wrong, I had a great time with my family but if you want to visit an island for the beaches, go to Provo or somewhere that actually has beaches worth seeing! This hotel was nice and clean. The beach was only feet away. One of the only beaches in PR that I actually enjoyed and we were all over the island so I saw plenty. Sunset was beautiful here. There were huge green lizards wandering around which was cool to see. The food was good and service was good. No real complaints about the place. If you happen to go to PR and are in Ponce, go here. But if you are looking for an island for relaxation and an amazing beach, go to another island. Seriously. I will laugh if I ever hear someone say they are going to PR for the beaches...

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!! with all the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: lunatere
Reviews.Content: Excellent services. Hospitality. The renewed room is a beautiful and good taste experience. They have all: golf club, beautiful pools and a lovely view. Ask for Carmen at the lobby-the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Vhazel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful! I was on the first floor and loved the little patios that were there when you opened your sliding glass door to look at the view of the grounds and the Carribean Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Kelmya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for families or adults traveling together. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and everthing is in working order. All rooms have a nice view of the ocean. There is plenty of outdoor space to spread out, by the pool(s) or beach area. You'll always find a quiet spot to relax. If you are looking for a more active vacation, there are bikes, kayaks, golf, swimming pools, and other amenities. As for meals, we chose the breakfast buffet and had dinner at La Cava (hotel restaurant) and at local restaurants. There are other choices off-site. Off site, you can visit Ponce Centro where you can board a trolley that tours historic sites or you can stroll around the plaza and enjoy and ice cream cone. On weekends, you can take a boat ride from La Guancha to Caja de Muertos, a small protected island where you can spend the day swimming and snorkeling. Bring your own picnic lunch. There are other day trips to Boqueron, Salinas, Bosque Seco, Gilligan's.

Reviews.Title: “Stay with all the amenities...finally renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year and noticed the rooms way old dated...To my surprise while staying in this property again during Memorial Day weekend, the rooms were finally renovated...actually they are in the process of renovating them, and we stayed in one of the renovated rooms. The hotel has 3 towers that are 5 story high. If you visit Ponce, this is the place to stay...Great resort with all the amenities, actually there are no properties like this one in Ponce. Minutes away from the airport, La Guancha (a local tourist attraction - a boardwalk, and the Ponce Yatch Club). The hotel has a nice Casino, four restaurants (including sushi bar), water sports, basketaball court, tennis, pool, etc...Great place to bring the family. Great place to play a nice round of golf at Costa Caribe Golf course...Only $68.00 / person for a round. the golf course has 27 holes, some of them with beautiful views, some in front of the ocean (hole 18 and 27). Very challenging with lots of man-made lakes. This golf course has the 1st island green in Puerto Rico (hole 12).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!!”
Reviews.Author: Jameco
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel for the family. The children really enjoy the activities. I always recommend to call before you are as close as possible to the pool by children. The casino area is quite large and the golf course, or say. I love this hotel. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean resort that keeps the kids entertained.”
Reviews.Author: Luzmada
Reviews.Content: The west coast of PR is not as lush as east coast, but this resort has lots of shaded areas and trees, for those that like to keep cool from the sunny, hot weather. The best part of the resort is all the activities available for children. We only spent two nights, and kept busy during day with site seeing, but could of easily just stayed at the resort all day. The pool was large, and activities were abundant. The beach was right at the resort. It also had another golf resort next to them, which we were able to enjoy that pool and beach area. The rooms were clean and fresh, the staff very friendly and always attentive to children. The restaurant food super, and fresh. We especially like the executive rooms, which had continental breakfast and evening snacks included.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: toddinparis
Reviews.Content: Not up to Hilton standard. Expensive for what you get - upcharged for a 3rd person who slept on a tiny, uncomfortable fold out chair with old linens. Bland, worn out lobbies. Pool area was so crowded with shade trees that you couldn't get a tan. Long hallways, takes forever to get to the lobby. Wild fluctuations in shower pressure & temperature. Tiny rooms, though clean. Views were very average, over rusted balcony railings. Beach was rocky, not sandy, and there was filth & garbage all over it. Maybe it's not the Hilton's private beach, but you'd think they would care enough to clean up the plastic bottles & rusted metal scraps. 30 dollar/day resort fee! Parking mark-up was a rip-off. Restaurant waiter added food to our order that we didn't ask for, then charged us extra! Overall, I paid way too much for a very bland experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MercyNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I must say that this Hilton Hotel is very nice & we were happy w/our stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The pools are nice but we were not happy w/the beach. The food is a little pricy but good. After a few days in Guanica, we went to Ponce & stayed at the Hilton. I must let everyone know that there is another pool & beach which is nicer (and still part of the Hilton) but you need to take the shuttle in the lobby that will take you to the other side. Not too many people know this b/c they donâ€™t tell you but one of the staff in the lobby was kind enough to tell us & take us there and show us around. Thatâ€™s also where you can golf, they have the Steakhouse for lunch open (12 â€“ 3 pm only) and they have a Sushi place which was really good and opened â€˜til late. If youâ€™re going to pay a lot for a stay at the Hilton, you might as well know of its other side and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Is Exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl30
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Ponce is a nice hotel. The rooms were very clean, and it's well equipped for a variety of activities. It's a great place for kids too (not that I have a kid, but there was a nice playground and it seemed kid friendly). I have to say that the staff is amazing. They helped me with anything and everything, and they were super nice. I can't say enough about how nice and helpful the staff was. For example (one of the MANY examples I have), it was my birthday, and I just told them, not expecting anything, and they sent two pieces of delicious cake complimentary to my room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but careful with the billing!”
Reviews.Author: DavilaBayamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at Ponce Hilton. When I called, the person who made my reservation did not specify some charges, such as a special hotel charge of nearly $20. and a parking fee of $8. for a night. When I checked out, my bill was about $50 extra dollars, including the tax fee. When I got home and checked my bank account, they had made a hold for $100 more than the amount charged by the hotel. I made calls, sent emails, and, finally, almost one week later, the total was updated on my account, and still was about $10 more than an invoice they had sent to my email. Beautiful place, but the service at the restaurant was slow and there were outside noises in the room that bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: Last week was the fourth time I have stayed at this hotel and I have never once been disappointed. The service is great and there is something about the hotel that makes me instantly relaxed upon arrival. I stayed in room 434 and it had a beautiful ocean view and balcony. The pool area is beautiful too. If you are looking for a relaxing place to get away from the hectic pace of life this is a great option. Don't pick this hotel if you want to swim in the ocean because this beach is not for swimming. It is a golf resort and casino located on the Caribbean but just not a good swimming beach. I slept with my sliding doors wide open and enjoyed the sounds of the waves all night long.

Reviews.Title: “A great oceanfront hotel jin Ponce!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDocGA
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ponce Hilton was wonderful. We stayed there for five nights and did not experience even one problem or disapointment. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The property is beautiful and has a perfect ocean view. It is a quick trip into Ponce, but you will want to plan some time to stay poolside or at the beach. I am a fan of Hilton properties, but this one rated right up there with the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Banquet Team and Hotel Facilities”
Reviews.Author: arijun
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding was held last Friday March 4, 2011. I want to express my gratitude for the excellent work done by all the banquet personnel. The food and the ambience was extraordinary. All of our guest were impressed with the outstanding service and the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “it's not a perfect world but this place is close”
Reviews.Author: dantidal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Ponce for 10 days and as always the vacation was great. We have been here about 9 or 10 times, again the weather was perfect 83 to 89 with a breeze each day . The golf course was in great shape as always, the club house staff is exceptional and sees to your every need. Valentines dinner at the LA CAVA was excellent along with the service and music. This trip we did not play golf everyday we took a break and scuba dived with Blue water Scuba. The owner of Blue Water - Jesus Morales was just great, if you are a diver or snorkeler and you're in Ponce, he is the man to see. This hotel is sooo consistent in service and cleanliness, that is why we return so often. I must say the weather in Ponce is also consistent dry and hot not like Florida or other parts of PR. I must say I am already planning our next trip to the enchanted island . Hilton Ponce Costa Caribe is my vacation destination, friendliness, cleanliness, value, GOLF, weather, restaurants and the Caribbean sea.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: sd9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a hideous slab of gray concrete. Do not go there. I went with my family and was hugely disappointed. Puerto Rico is so beautiful, it would be a shame to visit and get stuck at this ugly hotel. Pool and beach were dirty. Much better options near San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Plan to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JLG_11
Reviews.Content: Once past the reception desk (good experience) the service took a nose dive. We waited over an hour to be served in the La Cava Rest. No, it wasn't crowded. Food was over cooked and cold as well as over priced. The same terrible service was found at breakfast, food was better there. The one bright spot was the Steak House found at the golf club house, good food, good service, but only open for lunch?!? The beach was substandard, the pool small. Over all a disappointing experience with Hilton. The Casion had the aroma of a wet, dank musty basement. JG

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Personal Attention”
Reviews.Author: TJS44
Reviews.Content: Excellent manager's cocktail party that gave us an opportunity to converse with Hotel management on a one on one basis, enjoy fine DonQ cocktails and mingle with other guests. Outstanding gathering. Fabulous La Cave resturant. Great Valentines dinner

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: susan51184
Reviews.Content: we had a good time.the food and service was fine.staff was outstanding .it was very clean and comfortable.scott

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: WaiPRUSA
Reviews.Content: It's a good place to stay. Nice pool (although small), great service, good location, and friendly staff. The beach is fairly good, with good rates. The only offset to me, is that it doesn't have a good selection of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever been on the Army's dime”
Reviews.Author: Bandit2Actual
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, great location, awesome staff. Completely blew away my expectations of Puerto Rico. I'd go back again any day. Even with the ocean and pool water being a little chilly this time of year, the sun and weather was great and beat the heck out of what we're getting in the Northeast this year! If you're looking for a place to stay in south Puerto Rico on the beach, this is the place!

Reviews.Title: “FAB!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Japigirl
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the Hilton Ponce and eventhough I am Puerto Rican, I don't go to Ponce that much... Ate at La Cava - food and service super! Enjoyed my stay way too much! Coming back very soon! Kudos to Donna Bottman, who helped me arrange everything so smoothly. Gunther Mainka, the ever-so-ever gentleman. Thank you for making my stay unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: vinnyc99
Reviews.Content: What a wonderfull place. Everyone from management on down could not do enough for you. First time in along time I felt appreciated for your business. All there recommendations for restaurants and activities were great. Only problem was not enough time, will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: pcr01
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel before and they continue to impress me. My wife and I escape there every year for a few days. The hotel has everything that we like, a nice pool, a casino and a golf course for me. The thing about this hotel is the service, everyone has a smile and everyone wants to help you. The rooms are nice and large and have balconies that overlooks the ocean or the pool. The price is alway reasonable. We also love their restaurant, La Cava, I think that is one of the best restaurants in Puerto Rico, good food and tremendous service. We look forward to going back next January.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OutofKansas
Reviews.Content: I was pleased that the hotel is located on the beach and on the Caribbean side of Puerto Rico, but the beach behind the hotel was tan sand and the water looked brown. One of our colleagues suggested that a shower was necessary after swimming there; I was not inspired to swim. The pool was pleasant, but not very large compared to the size of the hotel. We heard there's another beach near the somewhat distant golf course, but did not visit it. A loud band was playing when we checked in, so it was difficult to hear the desk clerk. Gambling seems to be a major attraction, near the public areas, but we didn't try it. The rooms themselves are large, clean, comfortable and pleasant. I personally found the mattress too soft and woke up each morning with a sore back, but my husband had no trouble with it. We saw two rooms because we had to change the first one, a sea-view tower room, to another on the ground floor with a patio. They were both clean and well appointed. We appreciated the free wifi. But the hotel is rather brutal-looking concrete, some rooms are a great distance from the lobby, service in the restaurant was spotty and not consistently available, and the place is miles from any of the sights in Ponce. The meeting rooms were fully adequate, although there seemed to be some difficulty in adjusting the temperature, which went from freezing to hot in the course of a half day.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, terrible service, no water or sunscreen”
Reviews.Author: 60827Trvlbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a conference this week. While the hotel is clean and the rooms and views are GREAT, the service is terrible. Every time I asked for anything, I saw eyes roll. I brought a carry on to get down here and found that they were completely out of sunscreen when I arrived with no plans to get more. Also, I had an hour-long search for a bottle of water as the bars and restaurants had none for me before bed. I finally found the last vending machine with one left. Be careful what you bring to the pool. A colleague of mine got her watch and keys stolen from her pool chair while she swam. The service is S L O W when you ask for food or drink. But, I guess it allowed me to slow down too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and relaxing family oriented resort”
Reviews.Author: eeric
Reviews.Content: The scale of this resort is very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. We saw so many happy children that it tickled us. Every room has a view of the pools , palm trees and ocean. it is low key and truly a great get away spot. We loved having a refrigerator and table on the balcony so that we could have drinks and hor d'oerves in our room. The breakfasts and buffets were superb. The only downside was hearing folks in the next room partying into the night. My husband enjoyed the golf course, 27 holes, reasonably priced and in decent condition. The casino is small and busy with predominantly low stakes games. The resort is on the sea, though the beach is modest. The pool area is great, with small separate areas for groups. The activities are attractive, from mini golf to bicycles to basketball and the whole complex is warm and inviting. The center of Ponce is a few miles away, easy to get to by car, and parking is not difficult. After San Juan, Ponce and the resort are very easy going - not exciting but laid back. For a comfortable getaway, we would very much recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential...Service with attitude...Didn't care that we left 3 days early”
Reviews.Author: TravelinOnTop
Reviews.Content: This place defines the phrase "If it were not for the customers, we could get our jobs done" Hotel staff from check in to check out couldnt care less if we were there or not. Front desk clerk couldn't find our reservation...I produced copy and she said that "I should be glad" I had it! She accused me on 3 occassions of making res that day when clearly it stated I made them 10 days prior.She and the manager both exhibited the same "attitude" Bar staff NEVER asked to refill our cocktails...we had to "flag" them to get another drink. Room service, though prompt neglected several items. We left 3 days early and NO ONE asked why! GOLF HERE IS GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf Resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: nickdanny
Reviews.Content: It is well worth the one hour drive from San Juan to Ponce. The most reasonably priced golf resort. I have traveled to Case de Campo in the Dominican Republic and also to Doral in Miami and have now made the Hilton Ponce Costa Caribe my vacation getaway.
