The Golf course and staff are comparable to any vacation resort. The La Cava restaurant is absolutely a fine dinning experience. Five Stars in my book!!! We have traveled to this hotel the last seven years and are planning on returning in February 2011. No more Florida in the cold and where you can't count on the weather. We will be back in Ponce, PR enjoying the weather in February. I'm sure it will be in the 80's everyday. The beach may not be the Rivera but it is more than adequate if you love the salt water. The pool area is just great. And the hotel staff is top notch!!! In my book, this is the nicest, fairest price hotel/resort in Puerto Rico or in America. Daniel and Beatriz

Reviews.Title: “Best place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: SWAIN_P
Reviews.Content: Great service. Additional discounts to PR govt. employees during booking (Depends on negotiation). I booked the room 1 hr in advance. Free Vallet parking. Great tropical and sea food. excellent room service. Hotel is on the Sea really a heavenly place in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “Business and leisure.... brought 3 friends along on my business trip”
Reviews.Author: gigidev
Reviews.Content: Great hotel We got upgraded to two connecting suites. Lovely rooms. Great internet. Food was a little expensive, but not beyond what I expect in a hotel. We were there during off season. I think we were the only ones in the hotel at times.

Reviews.Title: “class.....”
Reviews.Author: davsbabe
Reviews.Content: 1st let me say i never felt so relaxed when on vacation.. the hilton ponce has a very profesional staff,no matter what we needed we just asked and there it was or someone went out of there way to get it. the food at the buffet is top notch the best we have had in a long time. LA CAVA is a hidden gem the wine selection wow the food is lovely.. if you ever find your self in ponce purerto rico this is were you want to be it is gated, it also has a sister resort on the same property were they sell and rent condos they are just lovely.you can get everything from sushie to steak to a whole pig and everything in between right at the resort..my husband go there every year for a week to ten days and book for the next year befor we leave this is home when we are in ponce. when leave there its off to san juan where we stay-. oh you have to read my other reviews for that info. oh one more thing this is a great place for children as well.we took our grandchildren they loved the pool and beach and the buffet.so take the family or just your sweety any way you wont be disapointed..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan_chic
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding in Ponce, with the reception at the Ponce Hilton. My guests thoroughly enjoyed this hotel, with its pools and beach access, golf course, fitness center, awesome restaurants and casino! It had plenty to keep EVERYONE entertained and it's a short trip to the center of Ponce. The beds are extremely comfortable and we slept so well there! This hotel and its staff managed to keep all of our guests happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyPilot
Reviews.Content: I stay over at Ponce Hilton for a wedding, staff was great. My tower room was impeccable, love the showers!. Great Food and the actual wedding ceremony and reception was wonderful. Another great job by Hilton

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENTE”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: SIMPLE the BEST in Ponce and South area of Puerto Rico. I go on monthly basis to work and I just love their pampering. I don't get ocean view all the time but when I do It just GREAT!!!! LOVE ITTTTT. Why stay in my mom's house :-)!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: Nancy62_10
Reviews.Content: We had to wait to check into a room, well past check in time. Our reservation called for an ocean view room and we had to press to get one. There were trays of dirty room service dishes in the hallway when we checked in and they were still there when we checked out. Every time we were in the lobby area, or the pool or poolside bar, we were surrounded by clouds of mosquitos and were covered with bites. When we went to the pool the next morning , the area had not been cleaned as yet. The fine dining restaurant was not open on Sunday evening. The one positive thing was the man working the front desk who was able to locate a cell phone charger for me, as I had left mine in another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel on an ugly beach- but probably the best place in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: TravelSnob1
Reviews.Content: HOTEL REVIEW # 178 Ponce Hilton MY TRAVEL STYLE: If possible, I try to stay away from business hotels and strongly prefer resorts that resemble the Four Seasons, Aman, and Oberoi but try to find similar properties at lower cost. I seek out the â€œwowâ€� experiences and I encourage you to view hotels I have stayed at and their respective reviews (by clicking on my name). LOCATION: Nothing within walking distance but 3 restaurants and a casino on property. On a mediocre at best beach. TYPE OF ROOM: â€¨â€¨OceanFront BED/SHEETS/PILLOW: Bed was comfortable and had better than average linens. Pillows were too thick and were not down. LIGHTING: Adequate in room/bathroom. BATHROOM/SHOWER: Definitely in need of remodeling. Shower had great water pressure and hot water. TOILETRIES: CrabTree (Typical Hilton products) CLEANLINESS: Room was very clean. A/C: Worked well STYLE OF ROOM: Zero style, COMMON AREA: Pool is ok/good, basketball court, tennis court, mini-golf, 3 restaurants, 3 bars. Good for a quick stroll, perhaps and excellent for kids. In definite need of remodel. QUIET/MORNING LIGHT: Room is quiet and curtains block out the morning sun. FOOD: We ate at the executive lounge which is complimentary for certain guests. At night there are softdrinks, coffee, rum, vegetables, and chicken skewers. In the AM, there are English muffins, breads, and cereals. TV/INTERNET: TV is not a flats creen and quality of picture was below average. There were many channels and the internet was complimentary and fast. SERVICE: People were friendly but we didnâ€™t ask for any special requests. SUMMARY: We checked out the Ramada as well which is in the historic area of Ponce and a much smaller, more of a boutique hotel. This is what I typically prefer but I donâ€™t know if I would want to be in that area at night. Although this hotel is mediocre, I would most likely stay here again if in Ponce. The oceanfront room really helped make this place more enjoyable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation was so great that the earth moved. lol”
Reviews.Author: wvrobert24
Reviews.Content: The earthquake got our vacation off to a rockin start. but back to the review, well in a nutshell this is a four+ star resort. Cleanliness- The resort was very clean i would have to give it to the staff they did a great job keeping the resort spotless. Value- Very appropriate. It dont think is a under or over price it is price right. Staff- overall very good. The valet attendants were awsome. (Neftali, Joshua and Jose were the ones that went above and beyond to answer any questions and were more like concierges than just valet attendants.) Restaurants- La Cava is very nice and definitely a must visit. La Terreza was great for breakfast (A little overpriced at 20 bucks a person i would have thought it was worth 12-14 but was still good.) For dinner it was ok but i would definately go outside the resort for dinner unless i was going to eat at La Cava. Lastly but not least the restaurant at the golf course was great for lunch, i wish i would have hit that for lunch more on my stay. I didnt try the sushi restaurant at the golf course but wished that i had. Grounds- The beach was ok and the pool was great. They have things to do putt putt, ping pong, basketball courts, volleyball and playgrounds for kids. Great fitness center. The golf course- Awesome. I mean great value great course friendly staff. Overall this is a four+ star resort that is great. I would go back there tommorrow if I could. Ponce is a great location the city is interesting it is close to the Phospherest bay which is a must see very cool. It is not as conjested as San Juan and is a perfect place to go if you want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to escape and relax for a day or two”
Reviews.Author: bf67
Reviews.Content: Stay for 3 nights in April 2010 - The property was OK. Too windy on the beach however the pool side was lovely. Enjoyed the gym. Loved having a breakfast & dinner buffet - breakfast was good, sadly each evening offered the same dishes :( - no buffet variety for the 3 evenings we stayed. Loved the room! Loved the beach view! Loved the late afternoon walks on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hilton over the Easter weekend. Most of the guests were from Puerto Rico. The hotel was full and there was a lot going on. The rooms were nice but not great. The floors were tile so no carpet, which works great for us! When we checked in the toilet in one of our adjoining rooms was leaking from the bottom. The hotel was full so there was no where to move us. The offered to fix it that night or give us a discount and fix it in the morning when we were out of the room. The management was very nice about the whole thing. It was fixed the following day. Although the hotel was full it was not loud. We used the pool at the golf club as the pool at the hotel was very crowded. The hotel pool was very nice. Don't expect much from the man made beach. There is a very good buffet in the hotel. We got the breakfast included with our room and it was worth it. Great breakfast buffet. This is not a really luxurious up to date Hilton and the location is not really near anything but we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best review. GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: utuado1968
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is the hotel to stay at. We loved the location in Ponce. The rooms were very clean. Maid service was excellent. Room had a fresh clean scent every day. The place has it's own beach which is soooo relaxing. beds are comfortable. view of the ocean - great. Hotel has a nice atmosphere. overall a very clean place and would stay there again. the staff was awesome from the start. right from the guard, to the parking attendant, the check in guy, and the waiters. The pool is really beautiful as well. There is a daily fee for parking but we knew that going in. The restaurants are a bit pricey but the service is great. cant see the complaints . stay here and you wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for getting away from the hustle of life because you are away from it all here”
Reviews.Author: DFWTravelers10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hilton Ponce for 3 nights and our stay was eventful and relaxing. The resort is a bit dated but fits in with the scenery in Ponce. Everything is open air except for the Casino, La Cava(restaurant), and the guestrooms. We started our stay on the first floor of the East tower in a room with pool access which was great. We were able to walk out of our patio and onto the pool and the beach. Rooms have a tropical decor which was nice. The next day, Moises at the front desk was very helpful in suggesting a place where we could have lunch in Ponce and his recomendation of La Casa del Chef was great! We tried Mofongo and although the food was luke warm to cold, it tasted good! He was very helpful with directions and anything else that we needed. The second night the people above us had 6 kids in their room running around and being very noisy on their patio so we called the front desk and asked if they could help and they moved us to a higher floor. The front desk staff that evening was extremely helpful and very willing to accomodate us, and they did. We decided to order room service this evening and Lores was so nice and friendly! Our dinner was great that night! On our 3rd day we got notice on our door that we would have to move rooms again because a group had already blocked the floor we were on. On this day, the front desk agent was not very helpful. We asked why we weren't notified sooner about this and she kept saying, "I have a deal for you. . " Well, it wasn't a deal because they first moved us to a smoking room even though the resort is non smoking. After heading back to the front desk and "talking" to the same front desk agent, we finally got upgraded to the Executive Tower and this room had an amazing view of the ocean and updated decor. That evening we ate at La Terraza, which is their buffet style restaurant and the food was amazing! They had a seafood buffet that included, Grouper, Crab, Oysters, Paella and Prime Rib to name a few things. Overall, aside from the front desk agent on the third night, the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. They truly want to make you feel at home and comfortable. The beach is black sand and the water is rough but it's relaxing if you sit there and look out. The grounds are kept up well and the parrott in the pool bar will squak at you from time to time. Bring mosquito spray as the humidity brings them out.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lotus100
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico. We spent a lot of time on Tripadvisor reviewing hotels and decided to stay outside of San Juan. Hilton Ponce had good reviews, and I am glad we went with the reviews. I was a little worried that it had a casino, because we weren't interested in that, and didn't want the late night party noise, but we never heard a peep. The atmosphere was warm, friendly, relaxed and attentive. The staff, all the staff, made you feel like they were glad you were there, which helped us feel relaxed right off. My husband and I are both vegetarian, and though this hotel didn't have a lot to offer a vegetarian, the staff (especially Alahendra) went out of their way to mix and match to be sure we were satisfied. At the recommendation of the staff, we took the Caribbean Images Snorkeling Tour, and that was outstanding - highly recommend that to any level snorkeler (it was my first experience snorkeling). This hotel was overall a wonderful few days. There is also a coffee farm not far up the mountain that gives a great tour of the farm, and a really interesting, informative info and coffee tasting session before the tour. The only advice I'd give the hotel is to have a good strong cup of coffee on the menu. Starbucks, or better yet, Pomarrosa coffee from the farm up the road in the morning would have been great!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hilton Property!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Ponce was everything we wanted in a vacation for location, service, cleanliness and fun! As a Hilton Diamond member, I can say that this was the best experience at a Hilton I have ever had. So many people go to Puerto Rico for vacation or pre/post cruise dates. Many of those never leave San Juan and after 3 trips covering most of the island, I can say that Puerto Rico is NOT San Juan. The Ponce Hilton is located a nice drive from San Juan but positions you where day trips to many attractions and activities are very easy. This trip had us at 3 Hilton properties and a villa on Culebra. Check in was a breeze. I did not have my reward certificate but they did the extra work to get the numbers they needed. We had a ground floor room in the Executive Tower (152). The rooms are decorated very nicely with all of the Hilton expectations met but with island flair. The patio is very welcoming and private despite the proximity to neighboring rooms. The rather large bathroom has a shower only but with both a large overhead shower and a handheld available. The neighboring resort, Costa Caribe has a beautiful 27-hole golf course and a separate clubhouse. Free shuttles are available to get to that resort. The pool at Costa Caribe is much less busy when the Hilton is full of families. Costa also has Hobie Cats, Sunfish sailboats and kayaks for rent. The Hilton itself has basketball, tennis, mini-golf, bicycles and ping-pong to go along with the pool scene. The pool has lots of chairs but still can get crowded on busier weekends such as Easter when we were there. Then again, EVERYWHERE is busy on Easter week in Puerto Rico. If that will be an issue for you, I would not travel to PR during the Easter break. The pool area also has many towering palms to help shade you from the sun if needed. The swimming beach is not spectacular. Darker sand and some reef make swimming less inviting. The Hilton does provide chairs in the sand for free both at the beach and within their gates in a nice sandy area complete with a playground. There are other beaches nearby with better conditions. If beach is your primary reason, this may not be the location for you. We are beach people though and found other places to have that experience such as Playa Santa, the beach at Cabo Rojo (salt flats and lighthouse) and the fun at Gulliganâ€™s Island. The Hilton is also very near the Bioluminescent Bay of La Parguera (also known for great Sangria)! DO THE BIO BAY! $6 on West Divers (ask for Junior if you speak English) also gives you the chance to get in the water and try it out. It is an experience you will not forget. If you have a GPS, bring it! It was invaluable in finding the places away from Ponce. Some reviews have suggested that concierge was not very helpful or always around. We did not experience this but found that the guys working at the valet stand had plentiful information and were exceedingly friendly! Neftali was particularly great and always found time to help us find somewhere to go! If you are allowed to use the Executive Lounge, do so! The breakfast is great and the free cocktails and appetizers at night are also fantastic. Free rum drinks there cost me $11 at the El San Juan (Waldorf Astoria). NOTE: See the review of mine for there also - ESJ is a horrible place! Non beach attractions include nearby Ponce Square, which is very neat offering a $2 tour of Ponce and others said the coffee plantation tour was very good! Lastly, the main restaurant was our place for breakfast on the weekend. The open-air restaurant is very nice but can get very busy on weekends. They do add extra buffet stations to accomodate and I found the buffet/omelet service to be adequate given the volume of people served. Service is â€œisland speedâ€�. It could be better but reflects what I have come to expect throughout Puerto Rico. The cost of the restaurant is a bit high in my opinion. $20 for breakfast is high (despite being free for us as Diamonds). If not free for us, I wouldnâ€™t pay that much. Dinners are much more expensive. Frankly in Puerto Rico, the best, most inexpensive food is found at locations along the edge of the highway. Coming from the US, that does not appeal to many but in PR, it is the best food we ate! Overall, we will most definitely stay again at the Hilton Ponce. The deviation from San Juan and the service given here exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good service - beach not the best”
Reviews.Author: borntoexplore
Reviews.Content: We first were tempted to leave upon our arrival. The vibe coming from the lobby/restaurant area is had to describe - it felt like a 70's Hotel. We checked the pool area which is shaded w palm trees and the beach and were not thrilled with either. I told the check-in rep that i am doubtful if we feel comfortable to stay although we had an non-cancel room rate. Her service was professional - being Hilton HH members she upgraded us to EXECUTIVE tower w/ a nice ocean view. the room was pleasant and modern (rather than the reg rooms) and we stayed for one night. The service was very attentive, Hilton is a business hotel catering to the needs of business traveller. However, they offered plenty of amenities for the kids incl free mini-golf, tennis f kids, playground, kids activities and actually nice pool area. Also i did not care for the ambiente from the hotel service incl bell-man made sure we had actually a good stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “I told my husband we should go back, it was that nice.”
Reviews.Author: NewTA
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. The view out of my room was amazing. The people working there were very nice and helpful, very friendly, and knew my name after the first day. The pool was big and clean. I only was meh about the food. It wasn't bad, but didn't match the views. I was speaking with a bartender who told me that the place was pretty dead since it was after Easter. There were still many business travelers and families with children. A colleague drove over from San Juan while I flew over the mountains. Apparenly both trips are worth taking.

Reviews.Title: “I hope you speak Spanish!”
Reviews.Author: danzer917
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this is my first bad review ever on trip advisor (so everyone knows I'm not just a complainer). This was not the worste stay ever at a hotel, but not my favorite! Here's the goods and bads: Goods: Location is amazingly beautiful, but pretty far from San Juan airport. The pool deck looks just like the pictures online. The view from our room (the cheap room) was outstanding. There was one waiter (Izac) who was friendly and one manager (Angel Hernandez) that was helpful when we were having a particularly hard time getting some lunch. Downtown Ponce has a trolley tour that only costs $2 (and for 2 dollars is was pretty good). Our trolley driver was very funny! It was easy to park at the Hilton and the beach towels were pretty big and soft. The lounge chairs at the beach were greatly appreciated and used daily! The breakfast buffet looked pretty good. I ordered eggs Benedict one day (as I don't eat enough buffet for the cost) and it took 1/2 an hour and my eggs were almost hard boiled they sat around so long. The strawberry daiquiri is very delicious at any time of day, however. The tuna wrap was pretty good and we ordered it a few times (although it was supposed to come with guacamole and it never did. I assume they were out, but a waiter should have said that when we ordered). Bads: There was not once when the food service was good! Over done food that took half an hour or more to bring out (even if we were the only ones waiting) was the norm. If there are spanish speakers around we found they ALWAYS got served first, even if your order was taken first. Waiting 15-20 minutes for a waiter to even acknowledge you was the norm. Several times I was at the bar and the bar tender would go around to all the spanish speakers before me, even if I came first. It often seemed as if the staff didn't really want to be working and they were taking it out on the patrons. My husband and I have been to jamaica several times and we understand island time, but taking an hour for a fruit salad and then not understanding why I get upset when it doesn't come is a little ridiculous! (By the way when the bar tender asked the waitress, who was talking, where the fruit salad was she gave him some attitude, rolled her eyes and walked away to talk with her friend a few feet away). At one point the credit card machines were down and my husband (and the rest of the army boys, we were there with the army) had to get to a meeting. Instead of telling us the machine was down the restaurant took the credit card and just held onto it for twenty minutes. When someone asked if they could get their card back because they had to get to a meeting, the waiter said no. He was going to hold onto the credit card for hours. This might have been an ok option if they had asked but just taking the card and not telling us what was going on was deceitful! We asked them the put the charge on our room and give back the card but they acted like we were asking them to move heaven and earth (I guess it's a lot of work to put something on the room). I try to be polite, but I feel like it was fairly one ended. We went to the casino one night and along with comp. drinks there was grilled cheese. We saw a bunch of spanish speakers going up to the waitress and grabbed sandwiches that were stacked up. (They people had just walked in so I don't think they pre-ordered). When my husband and I walked up and asked for one, the waitress turned away from us and walked the other way without saying a word. Also, bring your own sun screen! A 3 oz container of SPF 35 cost 13 dollars!! And don't ask the ladies in the gift shop for any help, they will only give you attitude and big sighs. The concierge was helpful in the sense that he gave us a map to get to downtown, but suggested nothing to do/ see/ or eat while down there. I often felt like I wanted to apologize for asking the staff to answer basic questions or bring out food. I understand it was hot and they didn't want to move fast, but I always say please and thank you and I don't think I deserved all the sighs and eye rolling that I got. It was exactly like telling my teenager to clean her room. The beach did not have the Caribbean clear water that we are used to and it was really rocky for the first five feet, but the waves were safe to play in for the kids. You did have to watch for big rocky wholes in the sand under the water that could cut up your feet but we soon learned where they were and were able to avoid them! I was fairly on my own with a teenage daughter because my husband was in P.R. with the army and although the army told me that everyone in P.R. speaks some english I did not find that to be true. We were very glad when we moved on to San Juan for the next portion of the trip!!

Reviews.Title: “On Beach Beauty and Quality Rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorldAdventurer_7
Reviews.Content: This is what I expect from a Hilton (not that I always get it). Really appreciated the Front Desk staff helping me with my late night, last minute request. Room overlooking the beach was beautiful and great to sleep to the crashing waves. Casino looked entertaining - even though we didn't partake.

Reviews.Title: “I would live there”
Reviews.Author: marlin1971
Reviews.Content: Great vacation spot with children. The service is excellent and everyone is so friendly. Great pool with plenty of shade from the palm trees. Plenty to do for the kids , with all of the playground facilities. Excellent buffet breakfast, and dinner variety with the inclusion of fine dining in La Cava. Just a great vacation spot. Management was responsive to all our needs

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue”
Reviews.Author: WillyV3
Reviews.Content: Hilton Ponce offers spectacular views, wonderful service, and a rate that can't be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bscott4913
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Ponce Hilton. The hotel is right on the beach which is very nice. There is a beautiful pool, excellent golf course and great tennis courts. The casino is small, but I don't really enjoy casino's anyway. The main restaurant in the hotel was very good. We enjoyed our meal there and the wine selection is outstanding. I would strongly recommend visiting Ponce and the amenities and location of this hotel can not be beat. However, it is important that you have a rental care if you stay here because it is about a 10 minute car ride to the historical sights of Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Diva_PuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Excellent, great hotel, great, comfortable, super clean rooms, the shower was nice! Beautiful pool and grounds! As you walk in the hotel grounds you notice that every part is well kept, the vegetation is very beautiful. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast buffet is the best! The chef cooks your omelet in front of you, and the best is that this is part of the buffet at no extra cost. The value for our stay was incredible. I recommend the hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: VDJTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. Nice hotel, nice rooms, friendly staff. Played golf at the Costa Caribe golf course associated with the hotel - nice course, not too difficult. Did not use the pool or beach access there but did use the beach access and pool at the hotel - no complaints. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced fantastic resort for relaxation, families, and golf.”
Reviews.Author: LinzerGirl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton Resort for 2009 New Year celebration with friends. The staff was very accommodating when we didn't particularly care for the location of our room and immediately gave us a first level patio with ocean view that was just above the pool area. We could walk out to the pool, tiki bar, beach rather than do the hallway through the hotel. Great location. The room was of generous size and the room decor was simple but adequate. The bedding was very comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job. The food was better than we expected with three types of dining; fine dining restaurant that was moderately pricey, casual beach/bar/tiki bar restaurant serving sandwiches and typical bar food, and a regular dining room with daily specials for dinner. Their salad buffet was awesome!!! Many choices and really very good. The grounds are beautiful with many palms offering lots of shade and plenty of lounges, tables and chairs. Although we didn't participate, there are bikes for use, small put-put golf course, and a lovely pool. Since it was a holiday, there were many families most of which seemed to be Puerto Rican. The beach was lovely and well maintained with several umbrellas. That area is locked during the evening for probable security purposes......keep intruders out and keep guests in. There were lots of youngsters in the pool, but we didn't see any misbehaviors. Since we are empty nesters, we would probably not reserve at this resort again during the holidays since it is too family friendly for our taste. The New Year parties rocked with two awesome live Latin bands that kept the music going the entire night. Our only problem with that was the noise level...it was ear splitting. We got the impression that many of the resort guests were actually Puerto Rican as compared to US or Europeans. They have a nice casino with typical gaming machines, several blackjack tables and a couple poker tables. We enjoyed that part of the resort, although the blackjack dealers are not as helpful or friendly as we found in other Stateside casinos. We did enjoy the fact that the entire hotel was smoke free due to the law that prohibits smoking in any and all public places. We only spent an afternoon in the city of Ponce, and it is a typical third world city with lots of color, noise, traffic and people. Due to the holiday, the museums were not open so we were not able to enjoy that cultural aspect. We had a slight billing problem, but it was resolved immediately upon our return Stateside. The Hilton chain is very customer oriented and dedicated to customer satisfaction. We certainly appreciate that. The Hilton Ponce is reasonably priced and a real value for the bucks. We highly recommend this resort to anyone that doesn't need city life close by.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay very relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: meprg
Reviews.Content: Took my family to Ponce, PR for Xmas week. We did not know the area but the flights were cheaper than going to San Juan so we took a chance. This Hilton was so lovely, and less expensive than the one in San Juan. Very friendly staff. Pretty. Comfortable beds, big towels and a two great swimming pools. We are always looking for hotels with long pools because we swim laps. The pool at the nearby golf club (included as part of this hotel) was great. Not crowded and a very good length. The food choices were fine - not expensive yet satisfying bar menu. Nice Salad Bar dinner menu too. We rented kayaks from the hotel and that was a fun outing. You must rent a car to really see the area. The beach at the hotel is not very pretty - there are nicer ones along the coast and and easy day trip. One tip - on the road into the hotel is a local fruit vendor (sells from his van parked across the field. We bought fabulous papayas from him almost every day.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry- I'd pass!”
Reviews.Author: Singerstravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and my husband and I were shocked at how outdated it was for a Hilton. The rooms have turqouis tile with very outdated furniture and bathrooms you'll want to make sure you have flip flops on at all times. The restaurants have poor service and less than desirable food. The casino was fun for some entertainment but you'll have to get over the musty smell. On a nicer note, it's great for families as they have a nice pool and outdoor playground, swingset, mini putt putt and basketball. Easy access to beach as well!

Reviews.Title: “Unapologetically lousy...”
Reviews.Author: craftyphd
Reviews.Content: My family decided to spend a weekend here to celebrate father's day. What the hotel failed to tell us until we arrived was that a huge promotional beach party (sponsored by Coors Lite) was scheduled for the weekend. We couldn't take the kids to the beach or pools because the smell of marijuana was too thick. The hotel staff and security didn't seem to think that this was a problem. Meanwhile, the music was blaring so loud the dresser mirror shook. It also played from 2pm until 2am. After complaining several times, my sister (a lawyer) had to go down and take care of business attorney-style. We were put in the business suites, which were a bit quieter. But the entire night was spent listening to kids partying the parking lot, running around the hotel drunk and stoned, and throwing up over the balconies. Calls to security were not answered...they were too busy trying to arrest a drug dealer on the premises.The next morning there was a line of patrons at the check-out line demanding refunds. The staff failed to apologize to us, instead shrugging their shoulders and saying, "we didn't sponsor the party". As a hotel patron, I'm disgusted. As a Puerto Rican, I'm embarrassed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hilton property, Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for "las Justas" using my diamond VIP benefit as the hotel was sold out; I was given a unit in the floor of the executive tower overlooking the ocean as well as access to the concierge floor; the hotel staff was very friendly and the hotel has beach access, the pool area is very nice and there is plenty of parking. The hotel might be a little difficult to find with GPS (at least the one that AVIS gave me) but once you get there is easy to find your way back if you go to town. The casino in the property is small but Ok. We had a blast!!! the property afforded us for a great spring break!! (bit pricey 200+ per night)

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: blunderNYC87
Reviews.Content: After staying in a scrappy hotel in Aguadilla "La Cima", this is heaven. Nice, clean and comfortable environment. Now hereâ€™s a place one would return too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay in Ponce, PR!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler240
Reviews.Content: Nice resort very busy casino, rooms are super clean and outstanding staff, best service we have had in PR. It was our anniversary my wife had a great massage and I played Golf, great course conditions, but very windy! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Escape From City”
Reviews.Author: edmort
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip with 23 month old and we found the Hilton Ponce relaxing and very child-friendly. Property kept in great shape, beach and pool at attached golf course better than beach and pool on hotel property. Stayed in King terrace room with three-way views of ocean. Great escape from city, if you want peace and quiet, this is your place

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: castlecreek
Reviews.Content: I stood their Feb 5 to Feb 9 the hotel is fantastic the rooms were beyond my expectation, the only down fall was the breakfast at the hospitality room the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: dj245
Reviews.Content: Be ready to be nickel and dimed to death at this hotel. Parking is $8/day. You'll need a car since the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. Internet is $10/day. You'll be hit with a mandatory "resort fee" of over $15/day even if you don't use it. The food at the hotel is ver overpriced, but you'll pay it because its a 15 minute drive to the nearest outside restaurant. The service I encountered was terrible. I stayed 21 days and each morning I was asked at least 3 times if I wanted Coffee. But the servers at night were extremely unattentive. We waited for over half an hour for a check once, asking each waitor that passed by. Eventually we just left without paying. Housekeeping was awful. One day, I was left 3 extra pillowcases but no towels. I left a bottle cap on the floor in the bathroom and it stayed there for over a week. My belongings were messed around with and my expense report reciepts were thrown away. Eventually I just put the DND sign on my door and left it there. I did not recieve my "welcome envelope" until the 16th day of my stay. I was jogging along the sidewalk in front of the beach and a Hilton truck came around a corner too fast and nearly ran me over. I know he was going too fast because the tires screeched and he slammed on the brakes. As for the room, it was big but in poor shape. Walls were paper thin and I always knew what my neighbors were doing. The curtains were very old and had "thin spots" where the light shone right through. The bathtub would not fill with water because the stopper was broken. Exterior concrete was cracked in many places. I would not recommend this hotel. I felt ripped off and ignored the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sanjuantraveller
Reviews.Content: The Ponce Resort is on the ocean away from the Town of Ponce. The golf course resort is attached to the main resort over a bridge which the hotel itself provides a complimentary shuttle. It has two pools, one in the main building, the other at the golf resort. I was a guest at this hotel one year ago and booked into the Executive Tower which is the furthest away from the main resort. Last year the Exectuve Lounge which is situated on the ground floor was open on the weekend as we had gone from a Friday to Saturday.This year however we were upgraded to the Executive Tower and the lounge was closed, only open now from Monday to Friday. The pool in the main resort building was closed for maintenance or whatever. I don't understand that as the tourist season is heavy in this time period and they have shut down one of the biggest attractions at this resort. They did apologize however and did give an alternative, which was to be shuttled to the golf course resort and use the pool facility there. What an inconvenice for the guests, especially with children. I was happy I bought a Bed and Breakfast Package which they offered. This staff at the breakfast area were unremarkable and very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was more then adequate for any guests. Clean, and an array of selections for breakfast, including cold and hot buffet and an omelette station as well. The rooms themselves are okay. Nothing spectacular. No special amenities, and no bathtubs whatsoever. The rooms only provide this massive shower. You can tell times are tough as even the grounds are not maintained as should be. TIP: If you aren't a golfer, don't go. The beach is nothing to speak of and the facility itself is the only one of it's type around there. It is 'JUST OKAY". Skip Ponce and just do a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: beach_vacation_18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, but the best part of it were the staff. The billingual staff was helpful and friendly and always went above and beyond to make our staff fantastic! The restaurant was average (great piÃ±a coladas!), but everything else was above average for sure! The whole facilities is beautiful and well kept, and there are gorgeous views from the rooms! I would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: harbir77
Reviews.Content: Everything about this resort was great. My wife and I had such a wonderful time that we are already looking for flights to go back. The resort is spectacular! The staff is extremely friendly and they were all very helpful. Everywhere we went the folks were really nice, either the bar, the beach, the front desk, room service or house cleaning. It's a really great place for couples because of the location of the hotel, which is in south Puerto Rico, far far away from the hectic hustle and bustle of San Juan. And because it's so far away from the high-traffic, high-pollution San Juan, the weather is much better than San Juan. We landed in San Juan and it was raining. Then we went on a one-day trip to San Juan and it was raining. Then on the flight back, it was raining again in San Juan. We stayed in Ponce 6 days and it DID NOT rain even once. The closest it got was a bit overcast in the evening one night. The breakfast is awesome! The other two restaurants at the resort are awesome! We had so much fun that we didn't even go to the Casino. We highly recommend this resort for anyone looking for a romantic getaway or with a family with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with its quirks”
Reviews.Author: Sibernewf
Reviews.Content: I am staying here now on business and the place is a great area. For whatever reason the hotel is next to empty. I would imagine around 10% full which in a place this big seems like you are all alone. The hotel itself is clean and lots of things to do. The rooms are dated and the beds are hard but clean and large. Despite the low numbers booked in I was put way on the end of the resort and i almost feel like im the only one staying here. I asked to be moved but was told this is the only area with a king bed and the rest of the floors and rooms dont??? I never pushed it... Breakfast.... Interesting.... Food was great and I was enjoying some nice waffles and sausage when I noticed birds... La Terraza is kind of open air so you expect birds, but these were invasive. I saw a black bird land on the table and begin picking at the napkins then he left a "white spot" on the table. Staff walked by and didnt even flinch. 5 minutes later a couple left after finishing and the birds invaded the table. 6 - 7 birds fighting over bacon and toast. This was right next to my table so I had to get up and ASK them to clean off the table. Then as another man left to refill at the buffet they invaded his table, ate from the syrup cup, took something off a plate, and a waitress, get this... shooed the birds away, topped up his OJ and left. When he came back I told him to eat at another table... That is just dirty in my mind and the staff were numb to it. Sports bar staff are not outgoing. despite tipping well and trying to strike up a conversation they retreated to the other side and talked amongst each other. I can see that if they are busy but on a slow night I would think they would at least talk. They seemed to understand english enough. Beer is 6.00 with DonQ rum 3.00 during Happy Hour 5 - 7. I think it was DonQ, weak drinks at that rate. Funny thing was the regular rate drinks had twice as much alcohol. Pool area is great and the beach is nice. Hope to golf later this week and take in some of Ponce. Will update more later with a final opinion on this resort. I highly recommend driving to Ponce from San Juan. The scenary is geourgous and it only takes hour and half on a good day.

Reviews.Title: “Always a 5 star stay!”
Reviews.Author: dolphingvp
Reviews.Content: Its always a good trip when you stay at the Ponce Hilton in Ponce Puerto Rico. I just spent 4 days and 3 nights at this facility and as usual I found it clean, the staff extremely friendly, and there was nothing you could need that was not available. Granted this is a 5 star resort, so if your looking for a bare bones cheap stay this is not the place. But if you want to be catered to, have the staff not only know who you are but be able to address you by name. If you want every possible type of food in what ever amount you want at a moments notice. If you want immediate access to 5 restaurants and 7 bars, a business center and an executive lounge. If you want full service spa's, training areas, casinos, night clubs, etc. then this is the place for you! If this sound like your kind of place the run, don't walk to the Costa Caribe Ponce Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: kathymtiru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with spectacular views. Staff are friendly and kind. I've seen remarks written about the double beds and it is true. Double beds not much larger than a single. Our room was right off the pool and feet from the beach. Retrieving the car was simple and quick. The breakfast was great. I would definitely come back. The only major thing we had a problem with but through no fault of the hotel was the putrid smell from the Don Q rum factory. It's enough to make you upchuck. Other than that - GREAT TIME. Check in/Check out - 123.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Tower the Best Bet”
Reviews.Author: AdvicePro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best in town. And the best deal is to be upgraded to the Executive Tower -- which gives you access to the lounge with (2) computers (free) to check email, continental breakfasts, afternoon snacks, cold drinks, tea/coffee, and at 5:30 pm small sandwiches and crudites, at 7:30 "desert" and liquers. In the evening, the "honor" bar is quite reasonable -- $5 for a glass of wine. You could make some of your meals here from the snacks and certainly save on expensive sodas, etc etc. Plus the concierge person manning the desk there can assist with tourist info, restaurants, etc. etc. The hotel isn't perfect -- it took 2 days to find out about the valet parking set up -- we were stopping at the desk each time to get our ticket stamped. Nothing was actually every explained to us about their faciities or various options. We had to explore and learn on our own. And if you are with a family -- keep in mind that their double beds are barely larger than a single; okay for very small kids only. That being said -- the main pool is the one for families and children. If you are an older (or romantic) couple and wish a bit less noise, you can take the shuttle (from the front of the hotel) to the country club and use their hot tub and pool. They will ask you to register at the hut where you get your towels (and you're given a wrist band to wear) but during the day the place is so much calmer. At either location there is a very small black sand beach...nothing to write home about ; it might entertain you for a very short walk to find some shells or old pieces of polished glass but not to sit on (although there are a few chairs at each). Keep in mind that it takes about 15 to 20 minutes for the shuttle to ever show up -- there's no set schedule. We only ate a couple meals at the hotel -- one lunch at the pool bar -- decent. Had the chicken fingers which came with fries (only $12) from the appetizer list. Sodas were around $3 each. The other meal we had was at the Sushi restaurant (not open everyday) at the country club part. This was just okay. A bit disappointing with limited selections but good for a change from fried foods and mofongos..and yes, expensive for the portions served. For kids -- there is the pool as mentioned, a playground area near the beach, and a small arcade area inside that was kept quite busy. For adults -- there is entertainment advertised on the weekends. Wasn't there then so no idea whether this is worth it or not. The casino is small but decent. Had variety of slots/machines and games. Wasn't very crowded or busy when we were there. The fitness room -- is decently equipped. Has the usual machines and is conveniently located near the main pool. You must be 18 to use machines. They have a spa/sauna == saw their signs but never had a chance to investigate. Did the two hour city tour (only one now available); you can drive up to see several other sites (may be next time) but didn't have the car at the time. Cab from downtown only cost $10 plus tip to Hilton. People at hotel basically quite friendly and helpful. Material distributed not always up to date, however, so do call (or have them call for you). Directions -- As in all of Puerto Rico, directions are horrible and not very accurate (even the Garmin GPS was off). You will be told go right and it's a left and vice versa. Allow yourself time to get anywhere you are going if this is the first time you're there. Many streets are not marked (signs are down or names change as you drive) plus there is a lot of construction on Rte 2 heading west towards Mayaguez (if going to Pitos restaurant -- recommended by the way)

Reviews.Title: “A great resort destination!”
Reviews.Author: roscoesquire
Reviews.Content: I loved my two-week stay here! Great breakfasts, lunches and dinners. Everything is open, and walking around the hotel at midnight is commonplace. It is an open community, with an excellent swimming pool, comfortable rooms, and a great location! The price could be hefty, but if you are on vacation, splurging (moderately) is not a big big issue! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: EmJay_1956
Reviews.Content: Been here now for 3 months. Accomodations are excellent. The beautiful people that work here are all very dedicted to make your stay the best. When they get real booked with holidays clients or conventions one can always go over to the Costa Caribe to spend some quiet relaxing time. Yes the food is pricy but this is a HILTON. Great for extended stays Em Jay_56 now in Ponce, PR

Reviews.Title: “Best Pina Coladas in all of Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: LuvTravel007
Reviews.Content: The one thing about this hotel is...Best Pina Coladas in all of Puerto Rico. The bartenders (yes all of them) at the sports bar by the pool have a serious bad attitude but they can make a awesome Pina Colada. The resort could use a remodel. It is dated. The staff at the front desk is friendly. The rooms are okay, definitely not U.S. standards for cleanliness. The fine dining restaurant is expensive but very romantic and has good food. There is nothing in Ponce to do. We went to the boardwalk marina area but it was boring. No shops or restaurants. Just a bunch of bars that were the size of a tool shed. I would not go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay, best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pixie5008
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ponce Hilton for two weeks in January and I really enjoyed my stay. Our room was clean and comfortable and the view from our balcony was beautiful. The pool was also beautiful and was a nice break from the beach on some days when the sun at the beach was too strong. Neither the beach nor the pool ever seemed crowded. The breakfast buffet was one of the highlights, with amazing fresh pastries and made-to-order omelets. Other than the pool and the beach, however, there wasn't much else to do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Ponce!”
Reviews.Author: YoungTraveler1
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Ponce Golf and Casino Resort was great! The staff was excellent. The stay wasn't perfect; my fiance and I arrived on a Saturday when the hotel had the Coors Light 'Wild Sessions' party poolside. It was great for a while until you wanted to go back to sleep. The party didnt end until 2AM and it was LOUD. The people next door were really young and filthy drunk. We had 3 noise complaints and the hotel brought security down once. Usually when a hotel gets 3 noise complaints the occupants of that room are kicked out. Besides that one unruly night, all went well. La Terraza was a great restaurant with affordable prices and delicious buffets. There was one waiter named Wigberto that was very sweet and informative of the area. La Cava was nice as well. The front desk answered all our questions. Bartenders were cordial and friendly even though they were very busy. Pool was overcrowded with kids though, so we went to the Caribe Pool. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Nice Hotel, Not Activities Destination”
Reviews.Author: DivingDuoATL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip as a graduation present for my nephew. We selected Ponce, due to its location on the Caribbean side of Puerto Rico. Overall, the hotel was clean, the staff was extremely accommodating, and we enjoyed our 6 day stay. It wasn't perfect in all respects, but setting proper expectations for the ages and interests of those in your travel party could help when deciding on this property. Below is a recap of our experiences. Staff- Excellent. Upon arrival, we were given a standard room in the Executive Tower. (2 double beds and a single person sofa bed -all in one room) for my husband and me and two 18 year olds teens. We booked a two room suite, so this was unacceptable. After much hard work from Rose Maria Alvarez, the hotel day supervisor, she rectified our situation and we were given side by side rooms. Kudos to her for recognizing the importance of honoring reservations, providing good customer service, and maintaining the loyalty of a Gold Hilton Honors member. We were also impressed by the valet staff that drove us to the Golf club each day, and the activities staff member at the club who helped us push our kayaks (and assist my nephew in getting back in). Food and Accommodation - Stay in the executive tower if you can. It is newer, and you have access to the Executive lounge. A continental breakfast was free each day, and they also had free drinks while you were in the lounge (sodas, waters, juices, etc.) The food at the hotel is average at best. Bar food at the pools, or two buffets (one at the hotel and one at the golf club). For lunch, the buffets are $22. We purchased a buffet discount coupon booklet that provided 10 lunch buffets @ $13 a piece. We would check out the items on the hotel buffet first and then decide if we wanted to ride over to the Golf Club buffet for another option. In general, the food and the view are better at the Golf club. RENT A CAR! We did, and ate dinner out near the mall in Ponce each night. It is about 5 miles away, but you'll want to leave the property as there is nothing else to do around the hotel. While there is a mini mart and gift shop on the property, we bought snacks, soda and water at a store near the mall. The rooms had refrigerators, and with sodas at $2.25 a pop at the hotel, you'll save some money. Activities - My husband and I planned to dive using a shop in Ponce and a shop in Guanica. Unfortunately, not enough divers for EITHER shop to go out, so no diving for us the entire week. This was extremely disappointing and bizarre for the Caribbean. My husband played golf at the resort on 2 days. I spent most of my time at the Golf club pool and beach, which is much nicer and quieter than the hotel pool and beach. Despite being on the Caribbean side of PR, the water is not crystal blue as you would typically expect if you've been to other Caribbean destinations. Sand is brown/gray. Not great, but ok. We also used the fitness center which has old equipment, but has everything you need from machines to free weights. In short, this was a relaxing break from work, but not the dive trip we had hoped for. The 18 year olds in our party struggled a bit. While there was tennis, basketball, table tennis, and the pools, they became somewhat bored after a few days. There are no planned activities (like volleyball games and other activities that you typically find at beach resorts). There seemed to be a lot of locals there that were part of a "summer club" and weren't too accepting of the guests. With nothing around the hotel to do either, they "relaxed" a lot. :) Despite this, we are not too hard to please and enjoyed the time away. I hope this information helps those reading to determine if this is the best setting for you. At the end of the day, the hotel was clean, offered good amenities, and is the right choice for those wanting to simply get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was golf.”
Reviews.Author: ATC08
Reviews.Content: The hotel only has one pool that was extremely overcrowded with people, the other pool was in the golf club which is about a 5 minute drive, I would recommend the golf course, it was beautiful. But the actual hotel looked like it hadn't been renovated since the 80's, & it was not very clean, our room smelled like a bad car freshner, we didn't even have a duvet cover on our bed there were just two sheets wrapped around the dirty comforter, the food was just OK, I guess I just expect more when you are paying 250 a night.

Reviews.Title: “I was impressed”
Reviews.Author: bazan111
Reviews.Content: My sister, my 2 year old daughter and I stayed at the resort for 8 days and 7 nights. We had a room in the Executive Tower. The rooms were nicely furnished. I was impressed with the marble bathroom and the removable spray shower heads (note there are no bathtubs in these rooms just showers). The beds were cozy and the linens were nice. We had a wonderful time and we were impressed with the facilities and its grounds. The pool was very big and one day we even visited the other pool on the property (by the golf course) and that pool was gorgeous as well. Note: the resort provides a free shuttle to transport you between the two. Also thereâ€™s not a lot of natural (i.e. tree) coverage from the sun there. The beach was beautiful, clean and safe, note thereâ€™s not much waves, if you want waves beach on the San Juan side provide this. They have a playground for the kids with included things like a jungle gym, swings and sea-saws. My daughter enjoyed them. We ate a late buffet lunch daily in the restaurant, the food was quite good and the selection was also good. We rented a car which allowed us to drive back and forth to San Juan and downtown Ponce as needed. I would definitely recommend renting a car if you stay on this side of the island. Youâ€™ll be glad you did and youâ€™ll be able to get around and come and go as you please. Downtown Ponce left a lot to be desired, many of the buildings were closed or under construction. I would recommend checking it out one night when thereâ€™s less traffic and you can see things better. This way you can plan and decide what you want to do and then come back another day to do it. There as a nice ice place downtown Ponce across the street from the fountain. All in all we loved it and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: BobIndiana
Reviews.Content: The pool in this hotel is great. My room was clean, the bed comfortable and the restaurant was great. I wish my wife had the time to take off and share that experience.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: PrettyGoodGolfer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort. There is so much to do at the resort that we only went into town twice. Once to see the historic square and once for dinner. We had an ocean view room on the third floor of one of the executive towers. The day we checked in, the hotel was so uncrowded that we wonder how the stay open. We are glad they do. Our room was large and spotlessly clean. The view from our balcony of the ocean was as good as any I've seen anywhere. We were on a golf package and played the Caribe Country Club for three days. If you think the hotel is uncrowded, you should see the golf course. One day we started at 9:00 a.m. and we were the only two people on the course for the first hour. The course are in very nice condition and enjoyable to play. The only drawbacks to this property are the pool, which is basically a kiddies pool and the price of the food. Portions are plentiful (too large actually) and the quality is good but the prics are a bit high. Fortunately, it is a short cab ride or drive into town to get some excellent seafood at more reasonable prices. Bottom line is we enjoyed ourselves so much, we are considering a week at this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: TejasJuez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of December 2007 for one night. The hotel has lovely gardens with fish, ducks, and turtles -- great for entertaining the kiddo. The pool is small but nice, and is saltwater. Because we were here for one night only, we didn't have time to enjoy a lot of the other amenities the hotel offers. If you're not into gambling, don't let the casino scare you. We didn't even know where it was until we were checking out. Unlike Las Vegas, the casino is behind double doors with a small sign, so it's easy to avoid. Our only complaint was that the hair dryer in the bathroom didn't work well, but it wasn't a big deal. Just a warning when traveling to Ponce -- nothing about the hotel here, but it is a buggy place. This was our second trip to the town (first to the Hilton) and both times, the bugs ate us up. Take lots of bug spray.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend away”
Reviews.Author: traveler80Omaha_NE
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I traveled to Puerto Rico to visit his parents but we wanted to get away for the weekend. This was the only place we could find with availability (even a month in advance). We were pleasantly surprised. The lobby was large and clean and the front desk personnel were helpful and friendly. We thought the room was modern and clean, and had a small fridge. Our room was ocean/pool view on the first level and we loved being able to walk right out to the beach. The hotel hosted a corporate family day on our last day and set up a huge tent almost right in front of our room. The crew was noisy constructing the tents, so we contacted the front desk and they offered a different room with a worse view, so we stayed. The pool was very small but clean with lots of kids around. We appreciated that the hottub stayed open all night. The sports bar by the pool served good (strong) drinks and good bar-type food. The lobby bar could be loud at night with the entertainment, The beach was windy and the sand was gray -- not overly exciting. We took the free shuttle over to the Costa Caribe Golf Resort pool one day -- they had a much larger and prettier pool, better chairs with umbrellas, decent beach, better poolside bar and slightly larger food menu, and a fabulous view of the golf course and mountains. It's worth it to go use that pool. Overall, we had a great weekend and were comfortable. It's a typical nice large resort. Staff was nice and the hotel was clean. We would go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “3 Star hotel pretending to be a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: asdfRi
Reviews.Content: Beware. This hotel pretends to be considered 5 stars, but at best they are a 3 star with ocean view. The service ranges from OK to mediocre, and the food is very expensive. The rooms are nothing to die for, and the main lobby is way too dark considering the extremely elevated crime rate of the area. If you are driving to the property you'll have to pay a parking fee. The interesting fact is that they have no personnel at the gate because a bunch of crooks assaulted them with shotguns and took all the money from their petty cash (a hotel employee actually told me this fact). So yes, crime will be at your doorstep, so be extremely careful and on the lookout. Some of the hotel staff are nice, but in general they don't make you feel welcome to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great get Away”
Reviews.Author: nycvegas
Reviews.Content: Just got back after 4 night stay. The hotel itself is great , exceptionally clean, well maintained and quiet. There are staff members that need to be trained in hospitality and being cordial. They have a little casino which caters mostly to locals and unfortunately theres a lot of nepotism. Customer grievances are handled hap-hazardly and unprofessionally. The wait staff really try to treat customers like family and do a fantastic job. The casino rates players but All I was able to get after 4 days of blackjack at $10 a hand was 4 virgin pina coladas, I took them. The slots are just tight . Since its that nicest hotel in the area I don't have much to choose from. Since my family lives in the area I have to deal with it. If you come here hope for a positve experience but remember youv'e been warned. It's in a isolated spot, there plenty of sun but beach is like volcanic ash. They charged $4.50 for guests to park overnight even thoough I was in the casino playing but locals have parking validated. They charge a $11.90 resort tax and there are no boats, kayaks or beach toys. They have a little gym and restaurants I did not patronize. A day trip to Ponce area can be done in three hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent retreat”
Reviews.Author: Kelmya
Reviews.Content: This is our third visit to Ponce Hilton. In addition to its excellent staff, Ponce Hilton offers many amenities at a reasonable rate. We walked around the grounds (kept very clean) in the morning and used the fitness center and the pool in the main hotel. We did not have time to use the pool at the Clubhouse, but we highly recommend it to those who prefer a quieter setting. Mosquitoes were not a huge problem. The hotel sprayed at night and kept the grounds free of debris. As for food, we had the continental breakfast and lunch at the hotel. The cold breakfast buffet offers numerous choices including fresh fruit, yogurt, soy, juices, cheeses, cereals, pastries, etc. You have the option of a hot breakfast as well. Ponce Hilton is an excellent choice if you plan to explore historic Ponce and Puerto Rico's southern beaches, forests, and other natural preserves. Before you venture out, make sure to stop at the front desk to confirm travel routes and other important information. We were planning to visit Gilligan's Island during our stay but changed our plans based on the information the consierge obtained from the boat operator when she contacted the company on our behalf. The main dock at Gilligan's had been damaged by recent period of heavy rain. The boat was still operating but accessibility was more difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Mosquito and dengue fever”
Reviews.Author: Phaser
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove from San Juan to stay 1 night. The hotel is nice but not great. The hotel and rooms are dated modern. Our room was OK, had a fridge, loved the A/C. Being a Diamond VIP, I had a selection of chocolates and strawberry and a large bottle of Fiji water waiting. The hotel has a casino which doesn't even call my attention. A nicely styled outdoor pool, a poor, ratty fitness center, a so-so beach area (watch out for the undertow) with soft, fine dark sand. All rooms are accessed from the exterior. We were in the executive tower which I guess is supposed to be exclusive. NOW, the very bad part: Perhaps due to the recent rains per a local (Ponce is on the leeward side of the island--drier and hotter) or not, but there was a horrendous mosquito invasion that could not be avoided even in the rooms. Despite heavy chemical spraying, they thrived loving the recessed door and patio areas of each room. Did I mention that Puerto Rico is closely monitoring an outbreak of dengue fever? We and others were running and flailing our arms and towels when going outside the rooms--remember all rooms are accessed from the exterior. It truly was horrible. We slept with the A/C fan on high (very impressive), temp set at 60 degrees with the ceiling fan on high over the bed--we slept with the covers covering our heads all because of the mosquitoes. Not even the "free" night using points was comforting and I still paid for parking. Nothing great at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wedded Bliss”
Reviews.Author: missesc
Reviews.Content: I was getting married at a local mansion, Castillo Serralles about 15 minutes away and felt this would be the best place to host my guests, and did not regret it. We started planning our wedding in March and had continious communication with Enid Montes in customer service. She is by far one of the most helpful persons there. She ensured that our guests got the best accomidations, and catered to their every need. She was also helpful in getting a limo two days before our wedding, and gave wonderful recommendations for local venues. The day of my wedding they allowed me to check into my room in the morning in order to relax and get ready for the chaotic day. My husband and I booked a spa day the day before and the girls at the spa are AMAZING. Gladys and Carla were so friendly and did a wonderful job. On the day of my wedding my stylist cancelled and Gladys was able to acommodate me the morning of the wedding. The room service was a bit slow, but I understood the hotel was hosting two conventions that weekend..so I was not disturbed. In terms of the appearance....I LOVED IT. The pool is open 24 hours a day, and each pool is clean and enough to host children and adults alike. True indeed once you leave the facilities it's not as picturesque as you'd like it to be but in all my travels I've encountered the same experience. I will say that my non Spanish speaking guests were able to get to hotel quickly because it is right off of Highway 2. My husband and I have decided that whenever we go to the enchanted island of Puerto Rico we will have to stay at least one night at the Ponce Hilton. We love it and would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: cbce1pjb
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 15 times and finally decided to write a review. This is nicest hotel in the area. Nice pool area . The beach area is nothing to write home about. After you leave the hotel beach area, the walk along the beach to the city park is nothing more than a garbage dump. I have always stayed on business. The executive lounge area room is a great benefit if you are Hilton Honors Gold. Free internet ,free snacks etc. Rooms are above average.The rooms in the Tower are newer but more walking.self parking only 4.50. Be prepared for slow service in the resturant for dinner. I usually go to the bar for a smaller menu and faster service. All the common areas are non smoking.The staff is excellent.Slow service in resturants is typical in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Digital824
Reviews.Content: This past July, we hotel hopped, Stayed in Fajardo, Isla Verde, and Ponce. Staying in Ponce allowed us to visit the central part of the Island (many mountains and incredibly beautiful) wich was only about half hour away. The northern part of Island was about 1 hour away and the West coast 30-45 min drive. We had never stayed at the Hilton, reading the reviews here helped us decide to risk it. Well worth it. Unfortunately, We only spent evenings and mornings there and did not enjoy the facilities enough. The next time down, we will spend more time at the hotel. The rooms were clean, neat and a sort of modern decor. The open lobby invites you to stay and enjoy the ocean breeze. The lower lobby restaurant, seemed to have a formal or semi formal setting, I'll try it next time. Pool was very spacious, many palm trees, and alot of facilities for the kids . Parking is extensive and the casino is entertaining and inexpensive . Staff couldn't be any friendlier. The beach is not good for swimming, but hey, 15-30 min away, you have many beautiful beaches. About 5 minutes south of the hotel is a place called La Guancha they have typical food and music. A beatiufl sunset there (currently my computer's background). The concierge gave us a map of Ponce, we visited downtown. Very historical; the architectural landscape was unbelievable, took some great pictures. People very friendly, a cop on every corner. Ck out the Fire Station, and have an Ice Cream at a store right in front of the fire station..... I had a coconut one and it was reallll goood Can't wait to re-visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd visit”
Reviews.Author: crackofdawn
Reviews.Content: We returned to Ponce after a visit perhaps 5-6 years ago. We stayed at the Hilton then and wanted to return. It was pretty much as remembered, though larger now. We really enjoyed the open lobby with the ocean breezes blowing through. Got a "bounceback" rate which included the breakfast which otherwise was $19/person. The Ponce Hilton is about a 2 hour drive from the San Juan airport. Warning.. PR drivers strongly favor riding along in the left hand lane. The slowest ones in particular migrate over to the left as soon as they can. It makes for maddening driving! Added since our last visit is a 27-hole golf course. They have a shuttle to take you over their bridge to the course. I got a really great rate on Saturday afternoon ---$50 after 2pm with complimentary clubs. Before 2 it would have been $75+$25 for the clubs! Lots of kids around the hotel. They offered free food for kids under 6(?) staying in parent's room. The large number of families seemed to be enjoying the hotel's recreational offerings, etc. Chose not to eat lunch/dinner there, but instead drove over to the restaurant El Ancla which is about a 5-7 min drive along the very industrial water front area. Very good seafood and service. Also wife came up with a 15% discount coupon when she took a tour of Ponce while I was playing golf. For lunch we did the waterfront area adjacent to the Hilton area (and before the industrial area) where there are many, many reasonable choices.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spotless”
Reviews.Author: MotherMayI
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here June 6-7. After "roughing" it for 2 weeks throughout PR and Vieques at relatives bungalows and guest houses, we needed a place with good mattresses, hot water, and cable TV at night. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was spotless and VERY clean. The shower was great. We picked this place because we wanted to enjoy the hotel room and its grounds. We would not be venturing out since we had been out exploring for 2 weeks and just wanted to relax in nice surroundings. (We explored Ponce years ago and that was great too.) We liked the fact that there were no pesky mosquitoes around the grounds. We took the 5 minute shuttle to the golf club pool - it was great too. The only down side was the beach was not a swimming beach. But we were "beached out" by the time we got there so just having that spectacular oceanview was so peaceful. We had a balcony room. Let me also mention that we arrived at about 7:30 a.m. from western PR and our room was available. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this Hilton - room noise”
Reviews.Author: BarryAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in Ponce on a business trip, Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday nights, June 10-12. I had stayed there once previously, also on business. It is a moderately attractive property -- an interesting, airy layout of the lobby and main restaurant lead out to the pool area, and from there to the beach. It's nice to sit in the restaurant and look at the Koi pond, the pool, and the palm trees. The food is OK, if a little expensive (about $38 for a dinner with one beer, including tip. $12 plus tip for the continental breakfast). The breakfast includes a nice variety of fruits, breads, pastries, meats, cheeses, and hot items such as eggs and pancakes. The rooms are nice, and large. The beds are comfortable. My only real complaint about the rooms -- poor sound insulation. One evening, a woman in the room below had a phone conversation, apparently with her balcony door open. The sound bounced off the concrete beams outside and back into my room. Even with my balcony door closed, I could hear (and understand) every word. It is perhaps fortunate that the place does not seem to get very crowded. (Based just on the two times I've been there.) There's never a wait for the restaurant. The beach is small, and sort of unattractive. The pool and surrounding play areas (volleyball, mini-mini-golf, basketball) are nice enough looking (I didn't use them). There's a huge excess of parking, yet they charge $4.50 per day for it ($10 if you valet-park). If you're in the west wing (as I was), the parking is closer than the valet desk, so you'll actually do less walking if you self-park. No HBO or other premium movie channel, but of course you can pay for movies. Some of my colleagues at work are residents of the Ponce area -- some of them grew up there. They say that the central historic area is nice, but that you want to be careful what areas of the town that you travel through.

Reviews.Title: “Will never go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiaNFl
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. The service is horrible and this is suppose to be a resort?? Tip #1 If you want a glass of water w/ your meal start asking for it early. It took exactly 4 request every time before I got one. 4 is the magic number. TIP #2 Prepare to have both of your room keys fail. Make sure you take both of them at all times because god forbid you get stuck outside of your room ...oh say about 12:00 at night because they will take thirty three minutes to send someone up to let you in. TIP#3 This is important. DO NOT plan on getting a buzz from any of the drinks mixed at the bars. Even though it "appears" that they are pour liquer into the drink take my advice and my 174.00 tab and go to the liquer store located just outside the guard gate (they will be more than happy to tell you where it is) and buy a bottle. Then purchase virgin drinks and add your own liquer. DO NOT expect to get good food here either and it is not inexpensive. Oh TIP#4 This one is for the women. If you are American be prepared. Apparently Puerto Rican women do not like American women EVEN THOUGH Puerto Rico is part of the United States. They treated my friend and I horrible. Tip#5 Unless you are from Manhattan or Tampa Bay you might just want to take a defensive driving course or get a prescription for Zanex. If you have never been to P.R you are instore for some of the worst drivers in the country. There are no white lines in the road. Yes that is right no lines therefore they are ALL OVER the place. I will never complain about New York drivers ever again. TIP#6 The final one. If you would like to blend in with the other drivers simply lay on the horn and just blow on through the red light or stop sign. Make sure your music is blarring so you can't hear anybody elses horns and you will be fine. BTW there is no service out on the beach so DO NOT EXPECT resort style service. This resort had more children in it than the Disney resorts. My advice is stay in San Juan there was much more to do and it is much more beautiful. Hope this helps someone save their hard earned money!! Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing vacation at the Ponce Hilton”
Reviews.Author: pieroghi
Reviews.Content: My husband, 17 year-old daughter and I stayed at the Ponce Hilton from April 9-15, 2007. We've traveled all over the world and we all agree that this one of our best vacations in terms of relaxing at a beautiful hotel. I would highly recommend it to others. Some keys to a successful vacation here: 1) Pay the extra $20+/day to stay in the Executive Tower. It's worth it for entry into the executive lounge - free internet use, complimentary breakfast, all-day snack and drink availability. You may have to also be a Hilton Honored guest member to access the lounge; I saw a previous entry regarding that. My husband was, so I'm not sure.
